list.item: First issue published by Perseus Digital Library on 07th April 2011

entry.sense: qbws A sort of Tunobuwr: see maEaAzifu.
1. qabaEa Als-iqaACa: see xanava.
qabiyEapN [The pommel of a sword;] the thing of silver or iron at the extremity of the hilt of a sword. (Ṣ, Ḳ.)
1. qabala as syn. with Oaqobala↓, q. v.: see Oadobara, in two places.
qabaHa Qll-ehu maA qabala minohu wamaA dabara: see dabar.
qabila He took, received, or admitted, willingly, or with approbation; he accepted. See qabuwlN.
qabilati Aln-aEolu The sandal had its qibaAl broken. (TA in art. XsE.)
3. qaAbalahu He faced, or fronted, or was opposite to or over against, him, or it. (Ṣ,* Ḳ.) See also Aisotaqobalahu↓ He, or it, corresponded to him, or it.

qaAbala kacaA bikacaA He requited such a thing with such a thing; or did, or gave, such a thing in return for such a thing; as good for good, evil for evil, good for evil, or evil for good. (The Lexicons passim.)

sense.hi: He counteracted such a thing with such a thing.

entry.sense: He compared such a thing, &c.
quwbila bikacaA It was compensated, or requited, by, or with, such a thing: see an ex. of the part. n. voce gunomN.
qaAbala AlX-aAp: see daAbara AlX-Ap.
farasN quwbila mino MfiqK waMfiqapK A horse that is generous with respect to both parents. (Ṣ in art. Afq.)
4. Oaqobalotuhu AlX-aIoCa I made it to face the thing: (Ṣ, Ḳ:) and qaAbalotuhu↓ AlX-aIoCa app. signifies the same: see a verse of El-Aạshà voce AirotisaAmN.
Oaqobala bihi [He turned it forward; contr. of Oadobara bihi]. (Ṣ, Ḳ, art. dbr.)
Oaqobala He came, facing; (JK, Ṣ,* Ḳ;*) came forward; came on; advanced; contr. of Oadobara. (Ṣ, Ḳ.)
Oaqobalotu qibalaka [not qubolaka] I advanced, or came, toward thee. Like qaSadotu qaSodaka. (L, art. Hrd.) See also Ḳur, ii. 172.
Oaqobala Ealayohi He advanced, or approached, towards him, or it.
Oaqobala EalaI UinosaAnK, as though he desired no other person. (JK.)
AqobaAlN The advancing of fortune; contr. of UidobaArN.
AlUiqobaAlu fiI Ald-unoyaA [Advance in the world, or in worldly circumstances]. (Mgh in art. jd.) UiqobaAlN signifies The being fortunate. (KL.)
UiqobaAlN i. q. dawolapN [Good fortune;, &c.; see tAmiku]: and Eiz-apN [might;, &c.]. (Kull, p. 64.)
Oaqobala Ealayohi He showed favour to him: or, more properly, he presented a favourable aspect to him; or, accord. to general usage, he met him kindly; see baX-a lahu.
Oaqobalato Ealayohi Ald-unoyaA, (A, art. ftH,) The world favoured him.
Oaqobala EalaI XaIoCK He set about, or commenced, doing a thing. (Ḳ, &c.)
See taSad-ada.
Oaqobala Ealayohi He clave to it: and he took to, set about, began, or commenced it; as also qabala↓ Elyh. (Ḳ.)
[Oaqobala Ealayohi biAls-ayofi, and biAlEaSaA, and biAls-awoTi He advanced against him, or set upon him, with the sword, and with the staff or stick, and with the whip.]
You say, Oaqobala Ealayoh biAls-awoTi yaDoribuhu [He advanced against him, or set upon him, with the whip, striking him]. (Ṣ in art. Hwl.)
See qabalN.
yuqobilu biAld-alowi UilaI AlbiYori and Oamoru fulaAnK AlaI UiqobaAlK: see Oadobara.
Oaqobal Ealayohi biAlt-aEoniyfi: see Ḥar, p. 508
Oaqobilo EalaI nafosika [Betake, or apply, thyself to thine own affairs]. (T, voce UilaI.)
dabarato lahu Alr-iyHu baEoda maA Oaqobalato: see dbr.
Oaqobala [He recovered, or regained, health;] occurring in the Ḳ, as the explanation of vaAba jisomuhu. (Ḳ, art. vwb.) Oaqobala baEoda huzaAlK. (Ḳ, voce HaXama.)
Oaqobala, with reference to the slit ear of a she-camel: see Oadobara.
OaqobilonaA bicim-apK, app. a mistranscription for OaqolibonaA: see cim-apN.
6. taqaAbaluwA They faced, or confronted, one another: see Ṣ in art. fqH.
8. Aiqotabalahu He began it, or commenced it; namely, an affair; (Ṣ,* Mgh, Ḳ;*) as also Uisotaqobalahu↓. (Mgh.)
10. Aisotaqobalahu: see Aisotadobarahu. He faced him, or it. (TA) He turned his face towards him, or it.

He went to meet him; he met him, or encountered him. He saw it before him: he looked forward to it: he saw it, or knew it, beforehand. He saw, or knew, at the beginning of it what he did not see, or know, at the end thereof.
Astqblhu biOamorK (T, Ṣ, Ḳ, &c., in art. bdh) He met him, or encountered him, with a thing. or an affair, or an action. (TḲ in art. bdh.)
Aisotaqobalotuhu bikalaAmK fiyhi giloZapN [I encountered him, or confronted him, with speech in which was roughness]. (JK, M, TA, art. jbh.)
Aisotaqobalahu He anticipated it; namely, Ramadán, by fasting before its commencement. (TA.)
See 8.
qabolu Before; contr. of baEodu; (Ṣ, Ḳ, &c.;) an adv. n. of time; and, as some say, of place also; (MF, TA;) and of rank, or station. (TA.)

saqaI Uibilahu qabalFA [and biAlqabali] He poured the water into the trough while his camels were drinking, so that it came upon them: (T, TA:) or qabalN signifies a man's bringing his camels to water, and drawing the water over their mouths, not having prepared for them aught [thereof] before that: (Aṣ, TA:) and saqaI EalaI Uibilihi qabalFA he poured the water over the mouths of his camels: (M, TA:) and Oaqabola↓ EalaI Uibilihi he drew the water over the heads of his camels while they drank, when they had drunk what was in the trough, (Lḥ, M, TA,) not having prepared it before that: and this is the most severe mode of watering. (Lḥ, TA.) ee an ex. voce jabFA, art. jbw and jbI.
nabalN is opposed to dabarN: see the latter.
n-a AlHaq-a biqabalK Verily the truth is manifest; where one sees it. (TA, art. Ejz.)
UicaA raOayota AlX-iEoraI biqabalK Alx: see M, art. dbr.
qibalFA I met him face to face. (JK.)

laA Oukal-imuka AilaI EaXorK mino ciI qibalK i. q. mn cI qabalK↓, i. e. [I will not speak to thee until ten nights] in what I [now] begin [of time]: or the latter, until ten [nights] which thou [now] beginnest: and the former, until ten [nights] of the days which thou [now] witnessest, (Ḳ, TA,) i. e. beginnest: (TA:) or the latter, of a time [now] begun; or, a future time. (Mgh, Mṣb.) And Oatayotu qulaAnFA manu ciI qibalK i. q. MnifFA. (Lth in T, art. Anf.)

qibala Towards. (Bḍ. ii. 172.) qibalu XaIoCu What is next to a thing: you say, cahaba qibala Als-uwqi [he went to the part next to the market]. (TA.) liI qibalahu maAlN I have property in his hands; i. e. due, or owing, to me by him; syn. Einodahu [q. v.] (Ḳ,* TA.) And lanaA qibalaka HaAjapN: (Ṣ in art. rwI, &c.:) see rawiy-apN (and Einoda also).

hecaA AlOamoru mino qibalihi This thing, or affair, is from him; syn. mano tiloqaAYihi and mano ladunohu, meaning mino Einodihi. (Lth, TA.) yatakal-amu mino qibali Oanofihi [He speaks from (i. e. through) his nose]. (JK and Ḳ, voce Oadogamu.)
AinoXaq-a mn qibali nafosihi It (a garment) rent of itself. (L, art. Swx, &c.)
qubulN The front, or fore part. See Ḳur, xii. 26. The former or first part: see dafaYiy-N.
Alqubulu The anterior pudendum (faroj) [vulva, and vagina,] of a man or woman; (Mṣb;) opposite of Ald-uburu. (Ṣ, Ḳ.)
maA lahu qibolapN walaA diborapN, &c.: see dbr.
qabaliI-N: see dabariI-N.
qibaAlu AlX-ibori and AlX-isoEi: see XiborN.
fulaAnN maA yadoriI qibaAla AlOamori mano dibaArihi;, &c.: see dbr.
qbaAlN of the sandal: see zimaAmN.

qabuwlN Favourable reception; acceptance; approbation: (KL PṢ:) love, and approbation, and inclination of the mind. (TA.) EalaI fulaAnK qabuwlN [Approbation is bestowed upon such a one;] the mind accepts, or approves, such a one. (Ṣ.)

qabuwlN Goodliness, beauty, grace, comeliness, or pleasingness: and [beauty of] aspect or garb. (Ḳ.) [And Acceptableness. Ealayohi qabuwlN may be rendered Upon him, or it, is an appearance of goodliness,, &c.]
qabiylN: see dabiyrN.
qabiylN Kind, species, class, race. mino qF Of the kind, &c. See qabiylapN.
jaMCa qubayola He came a little while ago; syn. MnifFA. (M in art. Anf.)
qubaAlatahu Opposite to, in a position so as to face, him or it. (Ḳ, &c.) See HiyaAlN in art. Hwl.
qubaAlapN The direction, point, place, or tract, in front of a thing; the opposite direction, &c.
qabiylapN A body of men from one father and mother: and qabiylN↓, without p, a body of men from several ancestors. (Az in TA, art. sbT.)
qabiylapN: see XaEobN.
A mass of stone or rock at the mouth of a well. (Ḳ and TA voce EuqaAbN, q. v.) See qaAbilN.
EaAmN qaAbilN, and muqobilN↓, signify the same, [A nextcoming year]. (Ṣ.) AlqaAbilapu i. q. All-ayolapu Almuqobilapu [The next night]. (Ṣ, Ḳ.) See AlqubaAqibu.
qaAbilN An arrow that wins [in the game of Almayosir]; (TA, art dbr;) contr. of daAbirN, q. v. (Ṣ and TA, art. dbr.)
qabaAYil of the head: see XaOonN.
And qabiylap↓ of a helmet: see TiraAqN.
qaAbilapN A wife. (TA in art. Ezb.)
qaAbiliy-apN [The quality of admitting or receiving; susceptibility].
Oaqobalu lilomawoEiZapi [More, or most, inclined to accept admonition]. (TA, art. rq.)
muqobilN: see qaAbilN.
[I. q. muqotabalN]. Ex. maqobilapN Alr-aHomi (Ḳ, voce jawaAriHu,) and AlX-abaAbi. (TA, ibid.) See madobirN.
vagorN baAridu Almuqab-alN [A mouth, or front teeth, cold, or cool, in the part that is kissed]. (A, art. xSr, &c.)
AlmuqaAbalu mina AlmanaAzili contr. of AlmudaAbaru, (M, art. dbr, q. v.)
muqaAbalN Noble, by the father's and mother's side: (Ṣ, Ḳ, TA:) see an ex. voce TaAbN; and see UizodawajaA.
muqaAbalapN applied to a ewe: see mudabarapN.
naAqapN muqaAbalapN mudaAbarapN: see dbr.
Aljaboru wAlmuqaAbalapu: see jbr.
fiI muqaAbalapi kacaA In comparison with such a thing: see an ex. in art. gyn in the Mṣb.
musotaqobalN, with fet-ḥ to the b, Looked forward to, anticipated, begun.
masotaqibolu Almajodi: see musotadibor.
qab-aAnN A steelyard: see Eamuwdu AlmiyzaAni.

qabaMCN [A kind of tunic, resembling the qafotaAnN, generally reaching to the middle of the shank, divided down the front, and made to overlap over the chest. So in the present day. See also Dozy, Dict. des noms de vêtements, pp. 352-62.]

2. qat-arahu He prostrated him upon his side, EalaI qutorihi [not ElI qutorahK, as in the Ḳ]; (L;) he threw him down upon one of his two sides, EalaI OaHadi qutorayohi, having pierced him [with a spear]; (JK;) like qaT-arahu.
Uibonu qitorapa The Hay-ap. (T in art. bnI.)
jawobN qaAtirN A shield of good dimensions. (Ṣ.) See yalabN.

1. qatala AlX-aIoCa, inf. n. qatolN, † He knew the thing; he was, or became, acquainted with it: (Mṣb:) [or rather, i. q.] qatalahu EilomFA, (Bḍ in iv. 156, and TA,) and xuborFA, (Ḳ,) and biEilomihi, (Bḍ, ubi supra,) he knew it (Bḍ, Ḳ, TA) completely, (TA,) or thoroughly, very well, or superlatively well; as also naHarahu EilomFA. (Bḍ.) See Oavobata AlX-aIoC maEorifapF in art. vbt.
2. qat-ala: see a verse cited in art. Etb, conj. 4.
3. qaAtalahu He fought, or combated, him; contended with him in fight or conflict or battle. qaAtala EalaI diyin Qll-ehi: see 3 in art. AzI.
5. taqat-alato lahu means taxaD-aEato lahu watacal-alato Hat-aI EaXiqahaA. (A.)

10. Aisotaqotala [properly He sought, or courted, slaughter;] i. q. AisotamaAta; (Ṣ, Ḳ;) meaning he cared not for death, by reason of his courage; (JM;) he resigned and subjected himself to slaughter, and cared not for death. (Mgh.)
qatolN: from this word is formed the pl. qutuwlN, on the authority of hearsay. (El-Jurjánee, in Mṣb, art. qSd.)
qat-aAlN [Murderous; slaughterous; very deadly.] You say Hay-apN qat-aAlahN [A very deadly serpent]. (TA in art. ASl.)
qaAtilN Deadly; applied to a tree; (Ḳ in art. xmT;) and to poison. (TA in that art.)
maqotalN A [vital] place in a man [or an animal, i. e.] where a wound causes death; (Ṣ, Mṣb;) as the temple: (Mṣb:) pl. maqaAtilu. (Ṣ.)
walin-iI maqaAtilaka means Haw-ilo UilaI-a wajohaka. (A.)
musotaqotilN: see musotamiytN.
1. qatuna: see qanuta.
qatiynN: see qaniytN.
1. qaHaza It (an arrow) rose in the sky. (JSh, in TA, art. XxS.)
qiHofN: see jumojumapN, in two places;
and qid-N.
A glass bowl; as also jumojumapN. (Az, TA in art. jm.)
qaHuwlN, applied to a man and to a horse, i. q. Ein-iynN. (IAạr in TA, art. Ejr.)
UinoqaHolN; see UinozahowN.
1. qHm nafosahu fiI AlOumuwri and tqHm-↓ fyhA and AqtHm↓ He entered into affairs without consideration. (A.)
5. taqaH-ama He experienced dearth, drought, or sterility. See an ex. voce tabiEapN.
taqaH-ama fiI AlOamori bilAa rawiy-apK [He plunged, or rushed, into the affair without consideration]. (Ḳ,* TA in art. ElT.) See 1.
taqaH-ama: see tadal-ava.
8. UiqotaHama. See 1.
Said of a young camel: see voce bulaEN.
AiqotaHama AlgamarAati: see 1 in art. xwD. And AqtHm AlEaqabapa: see EaqabapN.
qaHomapN, like qaHobapN, An old woman. See qaHobN.
muqoHamN Redundant; pleonastic; foisted in: applied to a word and to a letter.

HarofN maqoHamapN A letter inserted without reason. muqoHamapN is also applied in like manner to a word. [In a copy of the Ṣ, in art. bht, I find it written muqoHimapN]: i. q. zaAYidapN. (TA in art. bht.)
OuqoHuwaAnN: see baAbuwnajN. See also a verse cited voce tan-uwmN.
qaAduwsN (pl. qawaAdiysu) An earthen or wooden pot of a water-wheel. (PU.)
1. qadaEa farasahu He pulled in his horse by the bridle and bit, to stop him; (Ṣ, Ḳ;) he curbed, or restrained, him. (Ṣ.)

1. qadama Alqawoma, aor. _u {yaqodumu}, inf. n. qadomN (Ṣ,* Mṣb, Ḳ) and quduwmN; (Ḳ;) and taqad-amahumo↓; (Ṣ,* Mṣb, Ḳ;) and qad-amahumo↓; and Aisotaqodamahumo↓; (Ḳ:) He became before the people: (TA:) syn. sabaqahumo; (Mṣb;) he preceded them; went before them; took precedence of them; headed them; led them, so as to serve as an example, or object of imitation.
See Oam-ahumo.
qadima Albalada, aor. _a {yaqodamu}, inf. n. quduwmN and maqodamN, [He came to, or arrived at, the town,, &c.] (Mṣb.) OaxocaniI maA qaduma wamAa Haduva: see art. Hdv.
qadima EalaI AlOamori i. q. Oaqodama↓ Ealayohi [He advanced boldly to undertake the affair]. (TA.) See an ex. in a verse voce muDaAfN.
See 6.
2. qad-ama zayodFA UilaI AlHaAYiTi He brought Zeyd near, or caused him to draw near, or to approach, to the wall. (Mṣb.)

sense.hi: He put it forward; offered it; proffered it.

entry.sense: He brought, and brought forward, him or it.
qad-ama lahu TaEaAmFA He proffered, offered, or presented to him, food.
qad-ama He did good or evil previously, or beforehand: (Bḍ, and Jel in xxxvi. 11;, &c.:) he laid up in store. (Bḍ in xii. 48.) See zal-afahu.
qad-ama He made foremost; put, brought, or sent, forward; he advanced him or it: he promoted him.

qad-amahu EalaI gayarihi, inf. n. taqodiymN, He made him, or it, to be before, or have precedence of, another, in time: and in place; i. e. he placed, or put, him, or it, before another; or made him, or it, to precede another: and in rank, or dignity; i. e. he preferred him, or it, before another; or honoured, or esteemed, him, or it, above another. (Kull, p. 104.)
qad-amahu likacaA He prepared it, or provided it beforehand, for such a thing. See Ḳur, xii. 48.
qad-ama Einoda Qll-ehi xayorFA He prepared, or provided in store, for himself, good, [i. e. a reward,] with God. (A and Mgh in art. Hsb.)
qd-m lahu Alv-amana He paid him in advance, or beforehand, the price.

qad-ama Oano PafoEala kacaA He preferred doing such a thing; syn. Mvara, i. e. faD-ala. (M in art. Oavr.) [Hence, qad-ama AlEajoza fiI AlX-aIoCi He preferred backwardness with respect to the thing.] (See far-aTa and furuTN: and see Kull, p. 279.)
qad-ama syn. with taqad-ama, q. v.: like as Oax-ara is with taOax-ara: so in the Ḳur, xli. 1. (TA, art, Oxr.)
qad-ama [is trans. and intrans.: for its significations as an intrans. v., see its syn. tqd-m, and see 1:] as a trans. v. it is contr. of Oax-ara. (Mṣb, art. Oxr.)
qad-ama is syn. with badaOa bihi. (Mgh and Mṣb in art. bdO.)
qad-ama Uilayohi fiI kacaA: see taqad-ama.
See taOac-ana voce Mcana.
qad-ama OawolaAdFA and qad-amatohumo: see OaforaTa.
qad-amahu and Oaqodamahu↓ He urged him forward. (Moʼallaḳát, 157.)
qad-ama has taqodimapN for an inf. n.
4. Oaqodama He was bold, or audacious.
Oaqodama EalaI AlOamori He ventured upon, or addressed himself to, the thing boldly, courageously, or daringly; (Ṣ, Ḳ;) he attempted it.
Oaqodama ElI qironihi He behaved boldly, courageously, or daringly, against his adversary; (Mṣb;) he attached him.
See 1.
Oaqodimo, (improperly Uiqodimo,) said to a horse, Advance boldly! (Ṣ.) So rendered voce OahaAba, and habo.
5. taqad-ama He was, or became, or went, before, or ahead; preceded; had, or took, precedence; contr. of taOax-ara, q. v. See 1.
taqad-ama UilaI AlHaAYiTi He drew near, or approached, to the wall. (Mṣb.)
taqad-ama He advanced; went forward, or onward. (L, art. qwd.)
taqad-ama EalaI AlHaq-i: see Bḍ, xviii. 27.
taqad-ama He became advanced, or promoted.
taqad-ama minohu kalAamN: see faraTa: but the primary meaning is, Speech proceeded from him previously.

taqad-ama EalaI gayorihi quasi-pass. of qad-amahu EalaI gayorihi; He, or it, was, or became, before, or had precedence of, another, in time: and in place; i. e. he, or it, was, or became, before another; preceded another; went before another: and in rank, or dignity; i. e. he, or it, was, or became, preferred before another; or honoured, or esteemed, above another: in all these senses like taqad-ama gayorahu. See bak-ara.
taqad-ama fiI OamorK [He was forward in an affair] qabola fiEolihi [before doing it]. (AʼObeyd, T in art. rmI.)
taqad-ama i. q. sabaqa; (Ḳ, art. sbq, &c.;) and contr. of taOax-ara. (TA, art. Oxr.)

taqad-ama Uilayohi fiI kacaA, (Ḳ,) or bikacaA, (Mṣb,) or both, (Mgh,) He commanded, ordered, bade, charged, or enjoined, him respecting, or to do, such a thing; (Mgh, Mṣb, Ḳ;) as also qad-ama↓, inf. n. taqodiymN. (Mṣb.)
6. taqaAdama is best rendered It became old: and qaduma↓ it was old.
8. AiqotadaI bihi He did as he did, following his example; or taking him as an example, an exemplar, a pattern, or an object of imitation. (Mṣb.) He followed his example, imitated him;, &c.
10. Aisotaqodama He went before.
Aisotaqodamato riHaAlatuka: see art. rHl.
qadamN The human foot, from the ankle downwards. (Mgh.)
lahu qadamN raAsixapN fiI AlEilomi: see art. rsx.

sense.hi: Such a one is successor of such a one.

entry.sense: Existence, or duration, or time, without beginning; like OazalN (Kull, p. 31;, &c.) See OazalN.
EalaI wajohi Ald-ahori: qidamu Ald-ahori means properly the olden time; antiquity.
ElaIa qidami Ald-ahori [In, or from, old, or ancient, time; of old]. (Ṣ, M, Ḳ, art. Os; in the first and last of which it is coupled with the like phrase.)
mino qudumK [In front]. (Ḳ, voce ZunobuwbN.)
qudumN: see OuxurN.
qAadimapN as applied to a part of a camel's saddle is an improper word: the proper term is waAsiTN.

sense.hi: Ancient; old; to which no commencement is assigned.

entry.sense: maAlN qadiymN Old, or long-possessed, property. (Ṣ, A, Mgh, Mṣb, all in art. tld.)
qadiymN The reputation (HasabN) of a man or people. (TA, art. dvr.) See a verse in 1 of art. vnI.
Alqadiymu, as an epithet applied to God, i. q. Alqadiymu AlOazaliI-u The Ancient without beginning.
qawAdimu: respecting the feathers thus called, see voce manaAkibu, and Oaboharu.
jariIoCu Almuqodami: see art. jrO. Almuqodam is here syn. with AlUiqodaAm.
maqodaAmN Very bold or daring or courageous (Ṣ, Ḳ,) against the enemy; (Ṣ;) as also maqodaAmapN. (Ṣ.)
miqodaAmapN: see voce miEozAabap.
[The pl.] maqaAdimu Fronts; fore parts. See an ex. voce OaEovara.
maqaAdiymu The front of the forehead. (JK.)

sense.hi: A provost, chief, head, director, conductor, or manager.

entry.sense: muqad-amN The antecedent (or first proposition) in an enthymeme, and (first part) of a hypothetical proposition.
muqad-amapN The van, or vanguard, of an army.

muqad-imapN The ground whereon rests an inquiry or investigation: and the ground whereon rests the truth of an evidence or a demonstration: and a [premiss or] proposition which is made a part of a syllogism: and Almuqad-imapu Algariybapu is that [premiss] which is both actually and virtually suppressed in the syllogism; as when we say, A is equal to B, and B is equal to C, when it results that A is equal to C, by means of the muqad-imap gariybap, which is, every equal to the equal of a thing is equal to that thing. (KT.)
mutaqad-imN Preceding: anterior; being, or lying, in advance of others.
AlMmusotaqodimiyna in the Ḳur, xv. 24: see Bḍ; and see its opposite, AlmusotaOoxiriyna.
qudowapN and qidowapN (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ,) and qadowapN (Ḳ,) A pattern; an exemplar; an example; an object of imitation; one who is, or is to be, imitated. (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ, TA.) See UisowapN.
qidoyahN: see fidoyahN.
qaAdiyapN The first that come to one, or come upon one, of a company of men. (TA in art. THm.)
3. qaAcaEahu He reviled him, being reviled by him; and vied with him in foul, or unseemly, speech or language. (A, Ḳ.) See 3 in art. qdH.
1. qacafa biQloHijArapi wagayorihaA, aor. _i {yaqocifu}, inf. n. qacofN, He threw stones,, &c. (Mṣb.)

qacafa bihi He cast it; cast it forth; namely, an arrow, and a pebble, and speech, and anything. (Lth, TA.) It may sometimes be rendered He shed it; as, for instance, light into the heart, said of God.
yaqocifu biAlHaq-i (Ḳur, xxxiv. 47,) He (God) uttereth truth. (Zj, TA.)
qacafa biAls-ahomi He shot the arrow. (Lth, TA.)

qacafa He reproached, upbraided, reviled, vilified, defamed, or gave a bad name to, a chaste woman: (MA:) he reproached, upbraided,, &c. another; syn. Xatama. (JK.) Used tropically, qacafahu is most correctly rendered ‡ He cast at him an accusation: but it is commonly used and expl. as syn. with Xatamaha q. v.
qacafa He charged, reproached, or upbraided, (ramaI,) a chaste, or an honest, or a married, woman, with adultery. (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ.)
qacafaha bihi He aspersed him, reviled him; syn. Xatamahu. (JK.)
qacafaha bihi He reproached, or upbraided, him with it; he accused him of it. (TA.)
Also, i. q. OaSaAbahu bihi. (TA.)

wayaqocifuwna biAlgayobi (Ḳur, xxxiv. 52,) They uttering conjectures, (Zj, TA,) or uttering conjecture; (Bḍ;) speaking of that which was hidden [from them], (Ksh,) of that which had not become apparent to them. (Bḍ.)
qucifato biAll-aHomi † She (a camel) became fat and plump. (TA, voce AusotuEoriDat.)
qacafatohu AlqawaAcifu: see Taw-aHatohu AlT-awaAYiHu.
qucufN Land in which is no pasturage wherein cattle may freely range. (L, art. SH.)
qac-aAfN i. q. manojaniyqN: (Lth, Ḳ:) The kind of instrument with which a thing is thrown so that it goes far; n. un. with p {qac-aAfapN}. (Aboo-Kheyreh, Ḳ.) See marojaAmN and mirojamapN.
quc-aAfahN A sling: pl. quc-aAfaAtN. (MA.)
qawaAcifu: see TawaAYiHu; and Taw-aHatohu AlT-awaAYiHu.
maqaAcifu: see maTaAwiHu: Places of perdition; syn. mahaAliku. (TA.)

AlfacaAlu The whole of the back of the head: (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ:) or the part from the hollow of the back of the neck (nuqorap AlqafaA) to the ear: (El-Ghooree, Mgh:) [see AlqamaHoduwapu in art. qHd:] and, in a horse, the place where the EicaAr is tied, behind the forelock. (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ.)
1. qac-aAhu: see Har-aDahu.

qacFI What falls into the eye; (Ṣ, Ḳ;) a little piece of wood, or dust, that falls into the eye: (JK:) and what falls into beverage; (Ṣ, Ḳ;) as flies, &c.; (TA;) what betakes itself [or is attracted] to the sides of a vessel, and clings thereto: (AḤn, TA:) dust, motes, or particles of rubbish, as of sticks and stalks and straws, or the like, that fall into the eye or into water and beverage: (KL:) any floating particles upon water, &c.: [scum:] dirt that falls into the eye; (Mṣb;) what collects in the inner angle of the eye; (Ḥar, p. 65;) what comes into the eye, such as a bit of straw, &c.: (Id, p. 149:) [properly a coll. gen. n.:] qacaApN [the n. un.] a thing that falls into the eye and pains it: (Id, p. 259:) a mote.
OagoDaI ElI qacFI: see art. gDw.
1. qaraXa, aor. _i {yaqoriXu}, inf. n. qaroXN; and AiqotaraXa↓ and taqar-aXa↓; He gained, acquired, or earned, and collected, for his family. (M.)
5. taqar-aXa: see 1.
8: see 1.
quroSN A round convex ornament worn on the crown of the tarboosh. (See Modern Egypt. Appendix A.)
quroTN: see qiraATN.
qiraATN A lamp, or its lighted wick: syn. miSobaAHN or XuEolatuhu: (Ḳ:) the lighted wick (XuEolap) of a lamp; (Ṣ;) and so quroTN↓. (L, art. SbH.)
qaroTafN A red garment, of the kind called kisaAC. See kacaba, p. 2598 c.
qiroTaAlapN An ass's pannier, one of a pair. See kuwaArapN.
1. qaraEa in the sense of Daraba has maqoraEN for an inf. n. (Mgh, art. gmz.)
qaraEa fiI miqoraEihi i. q. Daraba fiI miDorbihi. (TA in art. Drb.)
qaraEa SafaAtahu ‡ He impugned his character; blamed or censured him; spoke against him (Mgh, art. gmz.) See magomazN.
qaraEa bayona Zufori UibohaAmihi waZufori sab-aAbatihi He fillipped with the nail of his thumb and that of his forefinger. (Lth, Ḳ,* TA, art. znjr.)
huwa AlfaHolu laA yuqoraEu Oanofuhu: see OanofN and qdE.
qaraEa Oanofahu, inf. n. qaroEN, † He rejected him, repelled him, or turned him back; namely a suitor in a case of marriage. (TA, in art. bDE.) See buDoEN.
Uin-a AlEaSaA quriEato liciI AlHilomi: see Freytag's Arab. Prov. i. 55; and Ḥar, 656.
laA yuqoraEu lahu AlEaSaA: see Freytag's Arab. Prov. ii. 543, and Ḥar, 655, in two places.
qaraEahu biEaSaA AlmalaAmapi: see EaSFA.
qaraEotu raOosahu biAlEaSaA and biAls-ayofi: see faraEotu.
qaraEa Zunobuwba baEiyrihi: and qaraEa liOamorihi Zunobuwbahu:, &c.: see art. Znb: and qaraEa liloOamori saAqahu: see saAqN.
2. qar-aEahu He reproached him for his crime or the like, saying to him, Thou didst so and so. (TA, voce muvar-ibN.)
qar-aEa He took, got, or won, a bet, wager, or stake. (L, in TA, voce nadabN.)
3. qaAraEahu: see its syn. saAhamahu.

4. OaqoraEa bayonahumo He ordered, or commanded, them to cast, or draw, lots, or to practise sortilege, [among themselves,] for the thing (EalaI AlX-aIoCi): (JM:) [see an ex. in the Mgh, in this art.:] or he prepared, or disposed, them, for doing so, for the thing (ElI AlXIC): (Mṣb:) or he cast, or drew, lots, or practised sortilege, among them. (Ḳ.) The first explanation is generally preferable. See Oasohama bayonahumo.
6. humaA yataqAaraZaAni Alxayora waAlX-ar-a: see taqaAraDaA.

Hub-u AlqaroEi Worms in the belly. (TA, voce XhdAnj.) But see duwdu AlqaroHi. AlqaroE is not a mistake for AlqaroH: Hab-u AlqaroHi is a corruption, found in medical books: Hb AlqrE is a name of the tape-worm, because each joint of it resembles a grain, or seed, of the gourd. (IbrD.)
qaraEN Bare pieces of ground amid herbage. (TA in art. xfI, from a trad.)

quwoEapN [A lot used in sortilege: lots collectively: sortilege itself. Used in all these senses in the present day, and app. in the classical times.] Daraba AlquroEapa He shuffled, or cast, or drew, lots; performed a sortilege.
qariyEN; pl. qaroEaI: see an ex. of the pl. in a prov. cited voce Aisotan-a.
huwa qariyEu waHodihi: see wHd.

qaAriEapu AlT-ariyqi The higher, or highest, part of the road; the part that is trodden by the passengers; [the beaten way]. (Mṣb.) In law books expl. as meaning OaToraAfu AlT-ariyqi; opposed to its jaAd-ap.
qaAriEapN A sudden calamity. (Ḳ.) See also Bḍ, and Jel, in xiii. 31, and an ex. voce Ainofaraja.
maqoraEN: see magomazN.
miqoraEN: see maDorabN.

miqoraEapN A whip: or anything with which one beats: (Ḳ:) or a thing with which a beast is beaten: (Az, TA:) or a piece of wood with which mules and asses are beaten: (TA:) [a cudgel: often applied in the present day to a cudgel made of the thick part of a palm-stick; and this, when used in sport, has several splits made in the thicker end, to cause the blows to produce a loud sound:] pl. maqaAriEu. (TA.)
3. qaArafahu He was, or became, near to it; meaning some base thing, or the like. (TA.) See qarafN.

qarafN The mixing with others; [and particularly with others who are diseased or the like]; a subst. from muqaArafapN↓: (Ḳ:) the being near to [a person, or persons, or a place, infected with] disease: (Ṣ, TA:) the being near to pestilence, or epidemic disease. (T in art. tlf.) See talafN.
OaEoraDati Alqirofapu signifies Uit-asaEato: (TA, art. ErD:) and Ait-asaEato qirofatuhu signifies kavura mano yat-ahimuhu. (TA, art. lbs.) See voce EaruDa.
maqorifN A place of paring off: see an ex. voce SamogN.
qiroqN: see TubonapN.
qurquEapN (TA, art. nqD): properly furoquEapN, q. v.
1. qarama It gnawed: see EuvayovapN.
qaromN: see muSoEabN.
quromN: see XaworaI.
quromapN: see fuqorapN.
qr-Am? A kid. (IAạr; in TA, art. Et.)
See miqoramapN.
miqoramN: see miqoramapN.

miqoramapN A coverlet of a bed; (Mgh, in arts. qrm and Hbs;) also called miHobasN: (Id, in art. Hbs:) or a thin curtain, accord. to some, figured; as also miqoramN↓ and qiraAmN↓: (Mṣb:) or this last, a figured curtain. (Mṣb.)
quromuwSN A hollow which a man digs wherein to sit to protect himself from the cold. (Mgh, art. rbD.) See an ex. voce rabaDN.
qiromilN, pl. qaraAmilu: see suf-apN.
1. qarana XayoYFA biXaIoCK He connected, coupled, or conjoined, a thing with a thing. (Ṣ.)
3. qaAranahu, (Ṣ,) inf. n. qiraAnN, (Ṣ, Ḳ,) and muqaAranapN, (Ḳ,) He associated with him; became his companion. (Ṣ, Ḳ.)
4. Oaqorana He gave of a thing two by two. (AʼObeyd in T, in art. bd, voce Oabad-a.) See Oabad-a.
Oaqorana AlX-aIoCa, (Mṣb,) or lilX-aIoCi, (Ḳ,) [the latter more probably right,] He was able and strong to do, or effect,, &c., the thing; (Mṣb, Ḳ;) He had the requisite ability and strength for it.

qironN One who opposes, or contends with, another, in science, or in fight, &c.; (Mṣb;) an opponent; a competitor; an adversary; an antagonist: or one's equal, or match, in courage, (Ṣ, Ḳ,) or generally, one's equal, match, or fellow. (Ḳ.)
qaronN One's equal in age; syn. lidapN, (Ḳ,) or tirobN: with fet-ḥ when relating to age, and with kesr when relating to fighting and the like. (Ḥar, pp. 572,64.)

qaronN, (JK, Mṣb,) or qaronN mina Aln-aAsi, (Ṣ,) [A generation of men;] people of one time (JK,* Ṣ, Ez-Zejjájee, Mṣb,) succeeding another qaron, (JK,) among whom is a prophet, or class of learned men, whether its years be many or few. (Ez-Zejjájee, Mṣb.)

qaronN The part of the head of a human being which in an animal is the place whence the horn grows: (Ḳ:) or the side, (Ṣ,) or upper side, (Ḳ,) of the head: (Ṣ, Ḳ:) or [more exactly the temporal ridge (see SudogN) i. e.] the edge of the haAmap (which is the middle and main part of the head [i. e. of the cranium]), on the right and on the left. (Zj, in his “Khalk el-Insán.”)
quruwnN of the head: see a verse cited voce xay-aTa. quruwnN of horses: see Oajam-u.
qaronN of a solid hoof: see jub-apN.
qaronN of a desert, the most elevated part. (TA in art. jHf.)
qaronu OaEofara, as meaning A spear-head, see OaEofaru.
qaronN A pod, like that of the locust tree: pl. quruwnN. Occurring often in the work of AḤn on plants, and in the TA, &c. See gaAfN.
qaronN [A thing] in a she-camel, which is like the Eafal in a woman; and which is cauterized with heated stones. (AA, TA, in art. Efl.)
qaronN An issue of sweat: pl. quruwnN: see two ex. voce san-a.

qaranN and qiraAnN↓ A cord of twisted bark which is bound upon the neck of each of the ploughing bulls (Ḳ,* TA) and to the middle of which is then bound the luWmap [or whole apparatus of the plough]. (TA.) See fad-aAnN.
[The pl.] OaqoraAnN Sons of one mother from different men. (TA, voce EayonN.)
qaranN: see jaEobapN.
quronapN The “horn” of the uterus.
qiraAnN: see qaranN.
OabaramFA qaruwnFA: see baramN.
qariynN An associate; a comrade; a companion. (Ṣ, Ḳ.) qariynapN A connexion; relation.
qariynapN [A clause of rhyming prose, considered as connected with the similar clause preceding or following; the two together being termed qryntAn]. (Ḥar, pp. 9, 23.)
Also, A context, in an absolute sense.
OasomaHato qaruwnatuhu↓ and qariynatuhu: see 1 in art. smH.
qaruwnapN: see qriynN.
Oaqoranu [Horned; having horns]. (Ṣ, voce kar-aAzN [which see]). See an ex. of the fem. qaronaMCu, voce daAna in art. dyn.
miqoranN: see mixocafN.
muqar-anN: see xaXoxaAXN.
Hab-u Alqaranofuli: see zajaAjN.
1. qaraI AlD-ayofa is doubly trans.: see a verse cited voce quwhN.

8. AifotaraI [meaning tatab-aEa: see a verse of Aboo Dhu-eyb, voce xaAfapN, in art. xwf.] It also means He investigated a country or countries. (Ṣ,* Ḳ,* TA, all in art. qrI; and TA in art. qrw.) He made much and diligent search. (KL.) See also 10 in art. qrO.
qirFI Entertainment for a guest; that with which a guest is entertained. (Ṣ.)
Water collected in a trough, or tank, for the drinking of beasts: see bay-uwtN: thus explained in the M in art. byt.
qariI-N A place where water runs, (T, Ṣ,) to, (T,) or in, or into, (Ṣ,) meadows, (T,) or a meadow. (Ṣ.) See XayoxN (last sentence).
Pl. OaqoriyapN: see qaroCN.

qaroyapN A town, or village; (Mṣb, TA;) a small balad, smaller than a madiynap: (MF, voce tiromic:) not well applied to a madiynap unless qualified by an epithet denoting greatness. (TA in art. madiynap.) See Bḍ, ii. 261.
naAqapN fiI qirowatihaA: see 4 in art. qrO.
qariy-apN [vulg. qaroyap The yard of a ship;] a squared piece of wood upon the head of the mast of a ship. (Az, TA in art. rnH.)
qaAriyahN A certain bird. See xuDaAriI-N and tanaw-uTN.
qaArK for qaAriYN, q. v.
naAqapN qarowaACu A long-backed she-camel. (IB, in TA, voce hirojaAbN.)
maqorFI: see 2 in art. Hjl.
maqoruw-N and maqoriI-N for maqoruwoCN: see art. qrO.
qazodiyrN: see qaSodiyrN.
qawosN qazaE: see quzaHa.
qzAm: see OaHoSana.
qasoqaAsN I. q. TufayoliI-N. (IKh, TA, art. Tfl.)
1. qasama and qas-ama↓ He divided; parted; divided in parts or shares; distributed.
qasama Oamorahu, or qas-amahu↓: see 3 in art. Edl.
2: see 1.
3. qaAsamahu AlX-aIoCa He divided with him the thing, each of them allotting to himself his share, or portion.

sense.hi: He swore to him by God.

entry.sense: 4. Oaqosama Ealayohi He conjured him; he said biHaq-ika. (Mgh, art. Tmr.)
5. taqas-ama It (a thing) was, or became, divided, or distributed. (MA.) See an ex. in a verse, voce Xat-aAna.
7. Ainoqasama AlaI OaqosaAmK kaviyrapK It was divided into many parts.
10. Aisotaqosama He sought to know what was allotted to him, by means of the OazolaAm, (Ṣ,* Mgh, and Ḥar, p. 465,) and what was not allotted to him. (Mgh, Ḥar.)
qisomN A division: (Mṣb:) and particularly (Mṣb) a portion, or share. (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ.) Pl. OaqosaAmN.
layosa mino OaqosAami kacaA It is not a part of such a thing; it does not belong, or appertain, to such a thing; it is independent of such a thing.
qasamN A conjurement. See Oaqosama Ealayohi.
An oath (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ) by God [&c.]. (Mṣb, Ḳ.) An asseveration.

qisomapN is also used in the sense of maqosuwmN [meaning A thing, or collection of things, divided into portions, or shares]: (Bḍ and Jel in liv. 28:) a portion, or share; like qisomN: (Mṣb:) [and portions, or shares; as in the phrase,] nuxoriju TariyqFA mino bayoni qisomapi AlOaroDi Oawi Ald-aAri [We will exclude a way, or passage, from among the portions, or shares, of the land, or the house]. (Mgh in art. rfE.)

sense.hi: An officer of the Kádee, who divides inheritances.

entry.sense: 3. qaAsaAhu He endured it; struggled, or contended, with, or against, it; struggled, or contended, with, or against, its difficulty, or severity; he endured, or he struggled, or contended, with, or against, the difficulty, or trouble, or inconvenience, that he experienced from it or him; [and so EaAnaAhu; for both of which see Ḥar, p. 564; and for the latter see XaAqaAhu; and for both see also mujaAnaApN]; syn. kaAbadahu, (Ṣ, Ḳ,) and EaAlaja Xid-atahu: (TA:) he underwent difficulties, troubles, or inconveniences, in doing it. (Mṣb in explanation of the syn. kaAbadahu.)
qisiI-u pl. of qawosN.
qusawiI-N: see art. qws.
qaX-N Stubble; stalk of corn,, &c.; straw. qX- AlbaHor Seaweed. qaX-N Rushes of which mats are made. HaSiyrap qX- A mat of rushes.
qaX-aAXN: see ram-aAmN.
1. qaXaEati Alr-iyHu Als-aHaAba The wind removed, or cleared off, the clouds; (Ṣ, Ḳ;) as also OaqoXaEatohu↓. (Ḳ.)
4. OaqoXaEa and AinoqaXaEa↓ and tqX-E↓ It (a cloud) became removed, or cleared off. (Ṣ, Ḳ.) See 1.
5: see 4.
7: see 4.

1. qaXifa, inf. n. qaXafa, He was coarse in his living: this is the original signification:
he was neglectful of cleanliness: (Mṣb:) he was neglectful of washing and cleanliness; unfrequent in paying attention thereto; slovenly with respect to his person: (M, Mṣb:) and taqaX-afa↓ signifies the like. (Mṣb.)
qaXifa, inf. n. qaXafN, He became sunburnt. (M.)
5: see 1.
quXaAmapN: see qamoXN.
1. qaSaEa: see an ex. voce SaAd-apN.
qaSoEapN A bowl not so large as a jafonap, but next to it in size, that satisfies ten: (Ṣ, voce SaHofap:) it is a wooden bowl.
qaSoEapu AlmasaAkiyni: see Alfak-apu.
Oaxacotuhu muqaASaEapF: see muEaAqaSap.
nabaAtN qaSiyfN ray-Anu [A weak, or fragile, sappy plant]. (TA, in art. xrE.)
1. qaSala: see xaSala.
qaSalN of wheat and barley: see juraAmapN.
qaSiylN Corn, or seed-produce, (Ḳ,) or barley, (Mṣb,) cut while green, (Mṣb, Ḳ,) for fodder. (Mṣb.)
miqoSalN: see maxoSalN.
qayoSuwmN Artemisia abrotanum, or southern-wood; also called qayoSuwmN cakarN: and qayoSuwmN OunovaI is applied to santolina.
2. qaS-aI: see qaS-aSa.
5. taqaS-aI: see taqaS-aSa.
taqaS-aI Xuroba AlmaMCi flm ysYr mnh XyO [He drank the water to the uttermost, not leaving any of it remaining]. (TA, in art. Xf.)
See 10.
10. AisotaqoSaI He went to the utmost length, or point, in a question, (Ḳ,) and in like manner you say, AisotaqoSaI AlOamora and taqaS-aAhu↓. (TA.)
[He exhausted a subject.]
[He proceeded to extremities. He was, or became, extreme, in an action, &c.]

AisotaqoSaI masoOalatahu [He went to the utmost point in questioning him, or asking him,] respecting a thing, so as to draw forth the utmost that he possessed [of information respecting it]. (Ṣ, art. nS.)

AisotaqoSaI fiI AlmasoOalapi and taqaS-aI↓ (Ṣ, Ḳ) both signify the same; (Ṣ;) ‡ He reached, or attained, [and elicited, and investigated,] the utmost [that was to be reached,, &c.] in the question: (Ḳ, TA:) and in like manner AstqSI AlOamora and tqS-Ahu↓ (TA) ‡ [He investigated, or searched, to the utmost the case, or affair;] he reached, or attained, the utmost of the case, or affair, in investigating it. (MA in explanation of the former phrase.)

sense.hi: He attained the utmost knowledge of it.

entry.sense: AisotaqoSaI maA Einoda naAqatihi mina Als-ayori [He elicited, or exacted, the utmost of his she-camel's pace, or power of going on]. (TA, art. nS.)
AisotiqoSaMCN, metonymically, signifies ‡ The being niggardly, stingy, or avaricious. (Az, TA in art. dnq.)
AisotaqoSayotu AlmakaAna [?] i. q. AisotaEocayotuhu. (TA in art. EcI.)
HuToniI AlqaSaA, and AlqaSaMCa: and HaATuwnaA AlqaSaMCa:, &c.: see art. HwT, and see 1 in art. Hbw.
quSoyaA is like dunoyaA and EuloyaA, with w changed into I. (ISd in TA, voce buqowaI.)

qaDoqaADN, (Ḳ,) and some say qaSoqaASN, (TA,) The OuXonaAn of Syria: (Ḳ, TA:) or the green, and lank (saboT), thereof: (Ibn-ʼAbbád, TA:) or a species of trees of the [kind called] HamoD, (AḤn, Ḳ, TA,) slender and yellow. (AḤn, TA.) See firosN.
qaDiyfN Lean, or light of flesh. (TA in art. Xlw.)
1. qaDima He crunched, nibbled or gnawed? See xaDima: and see also Freytag's Arab. Prov. ii. 245.
qaDaAmN: see xuDaAmapN.
maqoDamN: see xuDaAmapN.

qaDiymN as meaning A skin, &c. has for pl. OaqoDimapN [a pl. of pauc.] and quDumN, and quDomN, accord. to Sb, is a quasi-pl. n., (TA,) and qaDamN is a pl. [or quasi-pl. n.] thereof as meaning a white skin upon which one writes. (Ṣ, Ḳ.) See an ex. of quDumN voce EasiybN.

1. qaDaI He finished a thing entirely, by word, or by deed. This is the primary meaning. (Bḍ, ii. 111.) By word, as in waqaDaI rab-uka (Idem, ibid.) And thy Lord hath commanded decisively. (Idem, xvii. 24.) And by deed, as in faqaDaAhun-a saboEa samewaAtK [Ḳur, xli. 11, And he completed them seven heavens]. (Idem, ii. 11.)
And He (God) desired a thing so as to necessitate its being. (Idem, ii. 11.)
UicaA qaDaI OamorFA, [Ḳur, ii. 111,] When He (God) desireth a thing to be. (Bḍ, Jel.)
[Thus it signifies He decreed a thing; ordained it; pronounced it; or decided it judicially.]
qaDaI Ealayohi, aor. _i {yaqoDiIu}, inf. n. qaDaMCN, &c., He decided judicially, or judged, against him; and bayona AlxaSomayoni between the two litigants. (TA.) See qadorN.
[He completed; accomplished; or fully performed; a thing.]
qaDaI He attained, or obtained, or accomplished, his want. (Mṣb.)
[He paid, discharged, or satisfied, a debt, due, claim, or demand.]
qaDayotuhu Haq-ahu I gave him [or paid him] his due, (Mṣb,) fully. (Ḥar, p. 22.)

qaDaI Eanohu (Ṣ, Ḳ, in art. jzI, &c.) He, or it, payed; or made, or gave, or rendered, satisfaction; for him. (TḲ in that art.) And followed by XayoYFA [He paid a thing for him, or in his stead; gave, or rendered, it as a satisfaction; lit. and fig.] (Ṣ, TA in that art., and Bḍ in ii. 45.) See jazaI Eanohu; and see a verse cited voce daAna, in art. dyn.

He finished doing a thing: he finished his prayer. (TA.) He performed, fulfilled, or accomplished, the pilgrimage, syn. Oad-aI, (Mṣb,) and the religions rites and ceremonies of the pilgrimage, (Bḍ, Jel in ii. 196,) syn. qaDaIa bihi. (Jel, ibid, Mṣb.)
You also say, Hakama bihi He decreed it;, &c.; like Hakama bihi: see an ex. voce suloTaAnN.
qawoluhu mam-aA yaqoDiI AlEajaba [His saying such a thing is of the things that induce wonder in the utmost degree]. (TA in art. jlb.) See Ḥar, p. 22.
waqaDayonaA UilaI baniI UisrAYiyla (Ḳur, xvii. 4): see UilaI.
qaDuwa: see gazuwa, and hayuWa, and buTuMna; and see TamuEa in the Ṣ.
3. qaADaAhu He cited him before a judge. (TA.)
5: see 7.
6. taqAaDaAhu Ald-ayona He took, or received, from him the debt. (M, Ḳ.)
See 10.
And see taXaArayaA.
7. AnqDI and tqD-I↓ It passed away; came to an end, or to nought; became cut off. (Ḳ, TA.)

8. AiqotaDaI kacaA It required such a thing: it required the inference of such a thing: it necessarily implied, or involved, such a thing as its consequence or concomitant; it required such a thing to be conceded; it necessitated such a thing.
AiqotaDaAhu Haq-ahu He demanded of him his due. (MA.)
UiqotaDayotu minohu Haq-iI I took, or received, from him my due. (Mgh, Mṣb.)
10. AisotaqoDayotahu I demanded of him the giving [or payment] of my due, (Mṣb, Ḳ,*) or debt; (Ḳ;) and in like manner taqaADayotuhu↓ dayoniI and bidayoniI. (Mgh.)
qaDaMCN a term of the law; opposed to OadaMCN, which see: and see an ex. cited voce SaH-a.
A decree; an ordinance; a sentence, or a judicial decision. See EuwdN, HukomN and diynN.
qaDaMCN The exercise of the office of a ḳádee. [You say] AlqaDaMCu jamorN [meaning, the exercise of the office of a Kádee is one that often leads to hell]. (L, art. Ewd.)

qaDiy-apN A thing; an affair; a matter; a case; an event; an action: significations well known, but not found by me in any classical writing, nor in any lexicon, excepting as implied when the word is used in explanations: syn. OamorN and XaOonN.
A case of law. (L in art. jhd.)
qaDiy-apN kul-iy-apN [A universal or general prescript, rule, or canon]. (Kull, voce qaAEidap, p. 290; KT, in explanation of the same word.)
qaDiy-apN in logic, A proposition.
muqotaDaI [Exigence.]
muqotaDaI All-afoZi That which the word, or expression, indicates. (El-Fárábee, Mṣb, voce muEonFI.)
2. qaT-aEahu biAlD-arobi He mangled him with beating.
taqoTiyEN ‡ [A griping, or cutting pain, in the bowels;] i. q. magoSN in the belly; (Ṣ, Ḳ, TA;) as also taqoDiyEN. (TA.) See also quToEN.
taqoTiyEu AlS-awoti (Ḳ in art. jdf) A repeated interrupting of the voice in singing. (TḲ in that art.) See jadafa.
qaT-aEa, inf. n. taqoTiyEN, He articulated, or spelled, a word.
See taqoTiyEN.
qaATaEaA They disunited themselves, each form the other; severed the bond of friendship that united them, each to the other; contr. of waASalaA. (Ḳ.) See 6.
5. taqaT-aEa for qaT-aEa: see Ṣ, voce xaTara.
taqaT-aEa: see taSar-ama: It (a wound or ulcer) became dissundered, by putrefaction.
It (a garment, or a water-skin, &c.) became ragged, tattered, or dissundered, by rottenness. It (milk) became decomposed; it curdled, clotted, or coagulated; i. e. separated into clots.

6. taqaATaEaA [They became disunited, each from the other; the bond of friendship that united them, each to the other, became severed]; (A, art. ybs;) taqaATuEN signifies the contr. of tawaASulN: (Ṣ:) see taSaAramuwA.

7. AunoquTiEa bihi He became disabled from prosecuting, or unable to proceed in, or prosecute, his journey, (Ṣ, Mgh,) [his means having failed him, or] his means of defraying the expense having gone, or his camel that bore him stopping with him from fatigue, (Ṣ, Mgh,) or breaking down or perishing, (Mgh,) or an event having befallen him so that he could not move. (Ṣ.)
AinoqaTaEa fiI Huj-atihi [He was, or became, cut short, or stopped, in his argument, or plea]. (TA, art. bls.)
AinoqaTaEato qiraMCatuhu is said when one is unable to perform [or continue] his recitation, or reading. (TA in art. Ejm.)
UinoqaTaEa mina AlkalAami [or Eani AlklAm (Ḳ in art. rjw) He broke off, or ceased, from speech]. (TA, art. blt.)
AnqTE AlkalAamu The speech stopped short, or broke off. (TA.)
AinoqaTaEa Eanohu [He broke off from him; separated, or disunited himself from him]. See Ainobat-a; and see qaATaEahu here.

AinoqaTaEa It became cut off, intercepted, interrupted; or stopped; was put an end to; or put a stop to; it stopped, or stopped short, it finished, it failed, it failed altogether; ceased; became extinct; was no longer produced; came to an end.
He cut himself off, or became detached, or he detached himself, from worldly things, &c.
AinoqaTaEa wasakata mutaHay-irFA [He was, or became, cut short, and was silent, being confounded, or perplexed, and unable to see his right course]. (TA in art. bht.)

AinoqaTaEa UilaI fulaAnK ‡ He made himself solely and peculiarly a companion, or an associate to such a one. (TA.) And AinoqaTaEa Uilayohi app. signifies † He withdrew from a person or persons, or a place, to him, or it: see baMCa Uilayohi.
AinoqaTaEa fuwOaduhu: see AinocaEafa.
8. AiqotaTaEa [He cut off for himself] a piece from a thing: (Ṣ:) took a portion from another's property. (Mṣb.)
AifotaTaEa jadiyvahu: see 8 in art. qDb.
quToEN † Pain in the belly, and magoSN. (TA.) See 2.
qiToEN, applied to an arrow: see maqaATiyE and bariI-N.

qiToEapN A piece; bit; part, or portion, cut off, detached, or separated from the whole; a segment; a cutting; a slice; a slip; or the like: a piece, or portion, or parcel, or plot, or spot, of land, ground, herbage, &c.: a distinct quantity or number: somewhat, or some of a number of things.
A detached number of locusts: see rijolN: and so of a herd or flock, &c.: and a detached portion.
qiToEapN, of poetry: see qaSiydN: pl. qiTaEN, with which mufaT-aEaAtN↓ is syn.
qaTaEapN: see jadaEapN.
Darabahu biqaTaEatihi: see judomuwrN.

qaTiyEN A herd, troop, or drove; a distinct collection or number; of beasts, &c.; a flock, or bevy, of sheep, birds, &c.; a party, or group, or collection, of men, &c.; a pack of dogs. The term “herd” is applied to “a collective number” of camels by several good writers. We say a “flock” of sheep, and of geese; and “herd” or rather “herd” of goats; and a “herd” of oxen or kine, of camels, and of swine, and of antelopes; and a “swarm” of bees, &c.

sense.hi: A whip cut from the skin of a camel.

entry.sense: qaTiyEapN A portion of land held in fee. See Mgh, Mṣb.
quTiyEapN i. q. hijoraAnN. (Ṣ, Ḳ.) And qaTiyEapu Alr-aHimi [The cutting, or forsaking, or abandoning, of kindred, or relations; contr. of Silapu Alr-aHimi]. (Ḳ, voce HaAliqapN.)
rajulN qaT-aAEN liloOumuwri (Ṣ, M, A, Ḳ, all in art. qDb); see qaD-aAbapN.
OaqoTaEu All-isaAni † Unable to reply. (AZ in TA, art. bkm.)

taqoTiyEN Conformation, or proportion, of a man or beast; lineament of the face: i. q. qad-N, of a man: (Ḳ:) and the stature; or justness, or beauty, of the stature; of a man; syn. qaAmapN: (Ḳ:) and the cut, shape, fashion, or form, of anything: see an ex. voce zabanN; and also voce qad-N, where it is shown that, being an attribute of a thing as well as of a person, it does not always mean stature or the like: it signifies cut, shape, fashion, or form: and more commonly conformation or proportion: and hence, beauty, or justness, of stature; and simply stature, or tallness: pl. taqaATiyEu, which is more commonly used than the sing. in the present day.
maqoTaEN A place of crossing, or traversing, of a river [and a desert, &c.]: (Ḳ, TA:) pl. in this sense maqaATiEu. (Ṣ.)
Also the place of utterance of a letter; like maxorajN.
maqoTaEu AlHaq-i: see jalaMCN.
qahowapN laciycapu AlmqTE: see maz-apN.
maqoTaEapN A cause, or means, of cutting off, or stopping: see maHosamapN.
tiyaAbN muqaT-aEapN [Garments cut out of several pieces] are such as the shirt, and trousers, or drawers,, &c. (Mgh in art. vwb.)
daraAhimu muqaT-aEapN Dirhems [or coins] that are [clipped, or] light of weight, [or] in which is adulterating alloy: or, as some say, much broken. (Mgh.)
AlHuruwfu AlmuqaT-aEapu The letters of the alphabet: so applied in an explanation of Huruwfu AlmuEojami, as syn. with this, in the Ṣ in art. Ejm. See also HarofN.
See qiToEapN.
UisotivonaMCN munoqaTiEN An exception in which the thing excepted is disunited in kind from that from which the exception is made; contr. of mut-aSilN.
munoqaTiEN: see murosalN.
maqaATiyEu Heads of spears, or arrows; syn. niSAalN. (L, art. Sld.) See also qiToEN.
qiTofN A bunch of grapes, &c.: pl. quTuwfN: see an ex. voce cal-ala.
qiTofN i. q. maqoTuwfN. (TA in art. bsT.) See basiyTN.
qaTafN: see baqolN.

qaTaAfN and qiTaAfN↓ The time of gathering the crop of grapes: (Ṣ, Mgh, Ḳ:) or the latter has this meaning; and the former is allowable accord. to Ks: (T, TA:) and the latter is also an inf. n., (Mgh,) or may be so, (Ks, T, TA,) meaning the gathering of the crop of grapes: (Mgh:) [or both have this meaning; for] you say, hecaA zamaAnu AlqaTaAfi and AlqiTaAfi. (Mṣb.) See jadaAdN.
qaTiyfN a coll. gen. n. syn. with qaTaAYifu, mentioned in the TA voce OuboluwjN, which see.
qaTiyfapN A villous, or nappy, divaAr [or outer wrapping garment]. (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ.) See also rAaHuwlaAtN.
qaTaAYifu: see my 1001 Nights, note 23 to chap. viii. See also zalAabiyah. In the TA, art. knf, it is applied to kunaAfap.
miqoTafN (vulg. maqoTafN) [pl. maqaATif] A handbasket, made of palm-leaves: so called because originally used in gathering fruit. (See also quf-ap and zanobiyl.)
1. qaTana biAlmakaAni He resided in the place. (Mṣb.)
qaTonu syn. with qaTo: see the latter.
quTonu AlbarodiI-i: see barodiI-N.
qaTanN The part between the two hips, or haunches; (Ṣ, Ḳ;) or the downward [or lower] and even part of the back of a man; (Mṣb;) the lower portion of the loins.
qaTinapN i. q. HafivN, as its description plainly shows; i. e., the third stomach, commonly called the manyplies, and by some the millet, of a ruminant animal. See rum-aAnapN.

qiToniy-apN and quToniy-apN [Any kind of pulse, or seed of a leguminous plant that is cooked; this is the general meaning, and includes almost all the particular definitions of the word]: pl. qaTaAniI-u, (Ṣ, Mgh, Mṣb, Ḳ,) in the CK erroneously written with the article AlqaTaAniIu.
qaATinN A resident. (Mṣb.)
qayoTuwnN A closet; syn. maxodaEN; i. e., a [small] chamber within a [large] chamber. (L in art. sn.)

yaqoTiynN A plant (Ṣ, Ḳ) and the like (Ḳ) that has no saAq [or standing stem]; (Ṣ, Ḳ;) as the gourd-plant and the like: (Ṣ:) any tree [or plant] that spreads [or creeps] upon the ground, not rising upon a stem; such, for instance, as the colocynth; but conventionally applied especially to the gourd. (Mṣb.) See suT-aAHN.
qaTFA Sand-grouse; pterocles melanogaster: so Wilkinson, Ancient Egyptians i. 250: see De Sacy's Chrest. Ar., 2nd ed., pp. 369, et seqq.
qaTowapN: see daAliyapN.
qaTaApN, of a beast, The croup, or rump, and what is between the hips, or haunches: (Ḳ:) or [the fore part of the croup; i. e.] the place where the ridof sits. (Ṣ, Ḳ.) See AlguraAbaAni.
Oadal-u mino qaTaApK: see tub-aEN.
4. OaqaE-a AlmaMCa: see OaEaq-a.
R. Q. 1. qaEoqaEa: see an ex. voce Xan-N.

R. Q. 2. taqaEoqaEa It made a sound, or noise; a “crepitus;” a succession of sharp, or harsh, sounds, or noises; a creaking, creaking, rustling, clattering, clashing, rattling,, &c.: see an ex. voce Sal-a.
See EaqoEaqa.
maMCN quE-N or qaE-N: see Euq-N.
maMCN quEaAEN: see HuraAqN and Euq-N.
ximosN qaEoqaAEN: see ximosN and xaviyvN.
8. AiqotaEaTa: see AiEotajara.
AlAiqoTiEaATu and AlEim-apu AlT-aAbiqiy-apu signify the same. (O, Ḳ, in art. Tbq.)
7. AnqEf: see AnqEv; He died. (TA, art. qES.)
4. OaqoEaI It (a star) rose high, and then quitted not its place. (TA, art. Erd.)
AlUiqoEaACu: see Eaqiba.
1. qaf-avi AlOaroDu The land had its herbs, or leguminous plants, dried up for want of water. (A, TA, in art. Hf.) [See also qafiYat, said of land.]
qaf-a: see R. Q. 2 in art. jf.
8. AiqotifaAfN The eating until nothing remains. (Ḥam, p. 239.)
qaf-N: see gaf-N.
quf-N High ground, (Mṣb, Ḳ,) less than what is termed jabal: (Mṣb:) or a high portion of the maton of the earth: (Ṣ:) or high and rugged ground, not amounting to what is termed jabal. (Sh, TA.)
quf-apN (pl. qufafN) A basket of the same kind as that called miqoTaf, but larger; smaller than the zanbiyl: i. q. marojuwnapN. (TA in art. Dwn.)
qafiyfN: see qabiybN: and jafiyfN.
Alqaforu AlyahuwdiI-u Jews-pitch, i. e. asphaltum; also called mumia, and in Arabic muwmiyaA: see De Sacy's Abd-allatif, p. 273: and see tiroyaAqN and HumarN.
qafuwrN i. q. kaAfuwrN. (IDrd in TA, art. kfr.)
qafoXN A boot: (M:) or a short boot: (IAạr, Ḳ, TA:) or such as is cut, and not well made. (Az, TA.)
4. Oaqofala AlbaAba He locked the door. (TḲ.) See also Oagolaqa.
qafolN: see faraAXN.
qaAfilN A slender horse. (TA, art. xXb.)

qaAfilapN A company, or an assemblage of persons, travelling together: (El-Fárábee, Mṣb:) or a company returning from a journey: (Ṣ, Ḳ:) and commencing a journey; as auguring their return: (El-Fárábee, Mṣb, Ḳ:) he who restricts it to those returning from a journey errs: (El-Fárábee, Mṣb, in which see more:) a caravan.
1. qafaA Oavarahu and Uitorahu He followed his track, or footsteps; tracked him. (Ṣ, Mṣb.)
qafaA fulaAnFA He followed the footsteps of such a one. (TA.) See qaS-a Oavarahu, which signifies the same, for a better explanation. See also faqawotu Oavarahu.
qafFA The back of the neck. (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ.)

EayonaAhu fiI qafaAhu is said of him who is put to flight. because he looks behind him, fearing pursuit. (TA in art. Anf.)
And jaEala Oanofahu fiI qafaAhu: see OanofN.
[Also the back of the hand: and the flat back of a knife and the like.]
qafiy-apN: see dawaMCu.
qaAfiyapN, by synecdoche, for cuw qaAfiyapK, (IJ,) ‡ A verse; a single verse of a poem. (Akh, Az, TA.)
Also, [by a further extension of the proper signification,] A qaSiydap [or an ode, or a poem]. (Az, IJ, TA.)
qaAqawzapN and qaAfuz-apN: see TaAsN.
1. qal-a, It was, or became, few; small, or little, in number, quantity, or amount; scanty.
huwa yaqil-u Eano kacaA He, or it, is smaller than, or too small for, such a thing; syn. yaSoguru. (TA.)
qal-a labanuhaA Her milk became little, or scanty; she became scant in her milk.

qal-a xayoruhu [His good things, or wealth, and his beneficence, became few, or little; scanty, or wanting; he became poor; and he became niggardly:] for qil-apu xayorK signifies “poverty” and “niggardliness.” (A, TA, in art. Hjd.) And It became scanty, or deficient, or wanting, in goodness.
qal-a He had few aiders: sec an ex. voce fal-a.
2. qal-alahu He made it, or held it, to be little. (Mṣb.)
He showed it, or made it to appear, to be little, in quantity. (TA.)
See 4.
4. Oaqal-ahu He lifted it, or raised it, from the ground; and carried it. (Mṣb.)
Oaqal-ahu AlgaDabu † Anger disquieted, or flurried, him. (Mj, TA, in art. Hml.) And Ouqil-a [alone] † He was disquieted, or flurried, by anger. (T, TA, in that art.)
Oaqal-a minohu i. q. qal-alahu↓. (M.)
Oaqal-a He became poor: (Ṣ, Mṣb:) or he had little property. (Ḳ.)
5. taqal-ala (Ḳ, art. nzr) It became diminished, or rendered little or small in quantity. (TḲ, same art.)
taqal-alahu He saw it, or deemed it, to be little in quantity. (TA.)

10. Aisonafal-a He was independent, or alone; with none to share, or participate, with him. (TA.) [And Aisotaqal-a binafosihi, the same; or (as shown by an explanation of the act. part. n. in the TA) he managed his affairs, by himself alone, thoroughly, soundly, or vigorously.] And huwa lAa yasotaqil-u bihecaA He is not able [by himself] to do this. (TA.)

sense.hi: He was independent of all others; absolute.

entry.sense: Aisotaql-a He (a man) rose, or raised himself, with a burden: (JK:) and a bird in his flight. (JK, Ḳ.)
Ausotuqil-a gaDabFA He (a man) became affected with a tremour, or trembling, by anger. (JK.)
Aisotaqal-a biAlX-aIoCi i. q. Aisotabad-a bihi. (TA in art. Hkr.)
qul-N Poverty: see an ex. in a verse cited voce Tal-aAE.
qul-u bonu qul-K: see Dul-u.
qul-apN The top, or highest part, of a mountain, &c. (Ṣ, Ḳ.)
The top of the head and hump. (Ḳ.) See a verse cited voce Zil-N.
qltAni [app. qul-ataAni, or rather qalotaAni, from qlt] The hollows of the two collar-bones (AltrqwtAn). (TA, art. trb.)

qil-apN [Paucity; smallness; littleness; scantiness; want of due amount of anything: as in qil-apu mubaAlaApK want of due care: or this phrase signifies want of care: also fewness: for] qil-apN sometimes signifies i. q. EadamN. (Mgh in art. HfaZ.)
qil-apN may often be well rendered Lack.
qaliylN Few; small, or little, in number, quantity, or amount; scanty.
A small quantity, or quantum, or number, min maAlK wagayorihi of property, or cattle, &c.

qaliylu Alxayori: [see art. xyr, where an explanation is given equivalent to EaAdmu Alxayori: and in like manner] qaliylu Alxayori is used to signify Not making use of oaths at all. (Mgh in art. HfZ.) It may be well rendered Lacking, or destitute of, good, or wealth; as well as having little thereof: it generally means having little, or no, wealth, or good; or lacking, or destitute of, goodness or good things.
qaliylN: see maT-aridN.
Possessing little, or possessed in a small degree, of anything.
qaliylapN as a subst., Little: see kaviyrapN.
Oaqal-u maAlFA wawaladFA Possessing, or possessor, of less than another in respect of wealth and children: see an ex. (from the Ḳur xviii. 37) in art. f.
musotaqil-N A writing on a particular, peculiar, or special, subject.
risaAlapN musotaqil-apN A monograph. See also a verse cited voce gatomN.
AlqilAaSu, or AlqalAaYiSu, Some small stars before Ald-abaraAnu; [i. e., towards Alt-uray-aA; being between the Hyades and the Pleiades;] following Alvry-A. (Mir-át ez-Zemán.) Or The Hyades.
1. qalaEa and AifotalaEa↓ He pulled, plucked, tore, wrenched, or rooted, out, or up, or off; detached; removed from his or its place; displaced; (Mṣb, Ḳ *;) eradicated; uprooted; unrooted. (Ḳ.)

taqolaEu (Ḳ in art. jcw) and tqlEu Als-ayora (TA in that art.) [app. for taqolaEu fiI Als-ayori], said of she-camels, (Ḳ ib.) [app. They raise their feet clear from the ground:] see qaliEN and quloEN: the pret. seems to be qaliEa: so if taqolaEu be the right reading: but in a copy of the Ḳ it seems to be tuqoliEu: see jaAcK, art. jcw.
4. OaqolaEa It (rain) left off. (The lexicons passim.) It cleared away; syn. UinojalaI. (TA.)
OaqolaEa Eanohu He, or it, left him, or quitted him, or it. (Mgh, Mṣb, Ḳ.) He abstained, or desisted, from it. (Ṣ.)
OaqolaEa It (hard fortune) departed: see an ex. voce UibidN.
5. taqal-aEa fiI maXoyihi He walked as though he were descending a declivity. (TA.)

7. AinoqalaEa It became pulled out, or up, or off; became removed from its place, displaced, eradicated, uprooted, or unrooted; it fell, or came, out. You say, UinoqalaEato OasonaAnuhu [His teeth fell, or came, out.] (TA, art. Hs.)
8: see 1.
qalaEapN as meaning Large stones: see mirodFI.
qaloEiI-N: see raSAaSN and MnukN; in Turkish qalaAIo.
quluwEN is a quasi-inf. n. of the verb in the phrase OaqolaEati AlHum-aI: see Sal-a.
maqolaEN: see an ex. voce SamogN.
miqolAaEN A thing with which one throws a stone; (Ṣ;) a sling: (PṢ:) so in the present day.
See also mizoEaqN.
2: see 8.
8. Aqotalafa AlZ-ufora He pulled out the finger-nail by the root: (Lth, TA:) and so qal-afahu↓, accord. to a usage of its pass. part. n. in the T, art. Zfr.
qulofapN [also The prepuce of the clitoris of a woman;] a piece of flesh between the XuforaAni of a woman, which is cut off in circumcision. (Mṣb, voce baZorN.)
Oaqolafu has also for pl. qulofaAnN: see OaEoramu.
Q. 2. taqalofaEato Eani AlkamoCi OanoqaADuhu [The crusts of earth broke up from over the truffle]. (M, art. nqD.)

1. qaliqa, aor. _a {yaqolaqu}, (M, Mṣb, TA,) inf. n. qalaqN, (Ṣ, M, Mṣb, Ḳ,) It was, or became, unsettled, unsteady, unfixed, loose, mobile, unquiet, or restless; it did not settle, become fixed or motionless or quiet or at rest, or it did not rest or remain or continue, in its place. (TA.) He, or it, became disquieted, disturbed, agitated, flurried, or in a state of unrest or commotion; syn. AinozaEaja, (Ṣ, Ḳ, TA,) and AiDoTaraba. (M, Mṣb.)
qaliqa Uilayohi, or AlI liqaAYihi, see janaba.
2: see 4.
EibaArapN qaloqapN A loose expression. (TA, &c., passim.)
qalaAqapN Looseness in an expression. (TA, &c., passim.)
qalamN and qalamaAni↓ and qalamaAnN↓: see jalamN.

sense.hi: A writing-reed prepared for writing; a reed-pen.

entry.sense: qalamaAnN: see qalmN.
muqal-amu AlZ-ufori and AlOaZofaAri: see ZufrN.
qalam-asN: see naAsiYN.
1. qalaA and qlI He fried wheat; i. e. roasted it in a maqolaI [or frying-pan or roasting-pan]. (Mgh.)
qalaI with yaqolaI for its aor.: see OabaI.
huwa yaqoluw Albur-a: see baraI.

qalaI He roasted in a frying-pan (MA, KL) flesh-meat (MA) or anything: (KL:) and XawaI signifies the same. (MA.) qalaI Albur-a biAlmiqolaI and AlmiqolAapi means XawaAhu [i. e. he parched, or roasted, the wheat with the mqlI]. (Mgh.) The aor. is yaqoliI and yaqoluw, and the inf. n. qaloIN (MA, Mgh) and qalowN. (Mgh.)
qaloIN Potash; as is shown by the explanations in the Ṣ, Ḳ, and TA. Hence our term “alkali.” See HuroDN.
miqolFI A frying-pan; i. q. TaAjanN. (Mṣb in art. Tjn.)
4. Oaqam-a AlfaHolu Xawolahu and qam-ati↓ AlX-awolu: see OaXomala.
R. Q. 2. taqamoqamotuhu I took it, or devoured it, altogether. (TA in art. Eb.)
qumaAmapN Sweepings. (Ṣ, Ḳ.)
miqam-N A man who eats all that is upon the table. (Ṣ, Ḳ.*)
miqam-N and miqam-apN: see mivam-N.

qumoqumN A certain well-known vessel; arabicized from kumokumo; (Ḳ, TA;) a vessel of copper, in which water is heated; also called maHam-u; and called by the people of Syria gal-aAyapN; as also qumoqumapN: (Mṣb:) or a well-known vessel of copper, &c., in which water is heated, narrow in the head: and hence, ‡ a small vessel of copper or silver or china-ware, in which rose-water is put [for sprinkling, having a long and narrow neck, with a cover pierced with a hole or with several holes]; (TA;) the vessel of the perfumer: and, with p {qumoqumapN}, a vessel of brass, having two loop-shaped handles, which the traveller takes with him: pl. qamaAqimu. (Mṣb.)
qamoqaAmapN: see HalamapN and HamonaAnN and Tab-uwEN.
1. qamaEahu: see qamaOahu.
qamiEu Albusori What sticks to the date, around its stalk: (Mgh:) the base of the date. (Mgh, art. cnb.) See vuforuwqN.
See also a use of the pl. OaqomaAE, voce darodaAr.
qimaEu AlOucuwni The meatus of the ear: see julojulAanN.
1. qamila: see tiynN.
4. Oaqomala, said of the rimov: see HanaTa.
qum-alN i. q. suwsN: or a kind of quraAd. (Jel, vii. 130.) See saAsa.
muqomilN: see tiynN.
1. qamaha, aor. _a {yaqomahu}, inf. n. qumuwhN, i. q. qamaHa, q. v.
qun-apN An isolated mountain. (Ḳ, voce jabalN.) See a verse cited in art. Ez.
qin-apN Galbanum: so in the present day: see sakobiynajN.
rajulN OunanapN qunanapN: see art. An. The last word may perhaps be a mistranscription for funanapN (from fan-u): but this I have not found in art. fn.
qin-iy-apN The state, or condition, of slavery.

qun-aAbiraI A certain herb, or leguminous plant, (baqolapN,) growing forth in the beginning of the rabiyE; a Nabathæan word; called in Arabic tamoluwl [correctly tumoluwl] and gumoluwl; eaten by men; and called in Pers. barogaXot [correctly baroEasot]; called by the people of Ghazneh viriyod: (O:) correctly with teshdeed to the n, though in most of the copies of the Ḳ without teshdeed; and with kesr to the b, as in the Tekmileh. (TA.) See gumoluwlN.
1. qanobaEa, said of seed-produce or corn: see OaHonaqa.
qunobuEN: see rukobaAnu Als-unobuli, voce raAkibN.
qnwr- A large, long-bodied man. (Az, in TA, voce hirodab-apN.)
qanasN: see raAsanN.
quwonasN The [tapering] top of an iron helmet. (Ḳ.) See dan-N.
5. taq-anaEa biXaIoCK He was content with a thing. (Ḳ, voce tES-b.)

qunoEaAnN [not qunoEaAnu, as in the CK,] With whom one is contented, or satisfied, (Ṣ, Ḳ,) like maqonaEN↓, (Ṣ, Ḳ,) in respect of his judicial decision, or his evidence: (Ḳ:) used a like as masc. and fem. and sing. and pl. (Ṣ, Ḳ) and dual. (Ṣ.)
qinaAEN A woman's covering worn over the ximaAr [or head-covering]; (Mṣb;) a woman's headcovering, wider than the maqonaEap↓. (Ṣ, Ḳ.)
qinaAEu Alqalobi The integument of the heart; the pericardium. (Mgh in art. xlE; and Ḳ.)
qaAniEN, as used in the Ḳur, xxii. 37, accord. to some, One who asks, or begs. (TA, art. Er.)
maqonaEN: see qunoEaAnN
Uin-a fiI celika lamaqonaEFA [Verily in that is a sufficiency]. (Ṣ, M, in art. swd.)
muqoniEN: see SaAfiHN.
miqonaEapN [and miqonaEN, PṢ] A woman's head-veil. (MA, PṢ.)

maA OaboyaDu XaTorFA Oasowadu ZahorFA yamoXiI qimoTarFA wayabuwlu qaTorFA What is white in one half, black in the back, that walks contractedly, and makes water in drops? An enigma: to which the answer is, The qunofuc [q. v.]. (L.)
qunofucu layolK One who sleeps not [during the night]; because the qnfc sleeps not: (L:) and a calumniator; a slanderer; (L, Ḳ;) as also Oanoqadu layolK. (L.)
Also qunofucN and qunofacN The rat, or mouse; syn. faArN: (Ḳ:) fem. with p {qunofucapN}. (TA.)
qunofucN † The part behind the ear of a camel, whence the sweat exudes. (Ṣ, L, Ḳ.)
And, with p {qunofucapN}, † The part of the head that is below that which is called the qamaHoduwap. (L.)
qunofucN † A place that produces tangled herbage: (Ṣ, L, Ḳ:) an elevated place abounding with trees: AḤn says, that what is thus termed is in hard ground, between what is termed quf- and sand. (L.)

qunofucu ramolK † Sand collected together, (Aboo-Kheyreh, L, Ḳ,) and elevated, (Ḳ,) or somewhat elevated: (Aboo-Kheyreh, L:) or the abundance of trees of sand: or, as some say, qunofacu ramolK, with fet-ḥ, signifies abundance and tallness of trees of sand. (L.)
qunofucN (L, Ḳ) and with p {qunofucapN} (L) † A tree in the midst of sand. (L, Ḳ.)

qanaAficu † Mountains that are not long: or long and narrow tracts, (OaHobul, L, Ḳ, TA: in the CK, Oajobul, or mountains,) of sand: (L, Ḳ:) or hills with pointed heads (nabakN) lying in the way, or road. (Th, L, Ḳ.)
qanoqalN Half an Uirodab-. (T, voce Uirodab-.) See kur-N.
1. qaniIa AlHayaMCa He kept to the sense of shame, or modesty; (Ṣ, Ḳ;) he preserved it: and i. q. AisotaHoyaI: and AisotaqonaI↓ he kept to [or preserved] his sense of shame, or modesty. (TA.)
qanaA ganamFA, and AiqotanaI↓, He took for himself, got, or acquired, sheep, or goats [for a permanent possession], not for sale. (JK.)
3. qaAnaI: see qaAnaOa.

8. AqotanaI He gained, acquired, or got, for himself, (Ṣ, Ḳ,) or took for himself, (Mgh,) property, or camels, &c., (Ṣ, Mgh,) as a permanent stock, for propagation, (Mgh,) not for merchandise: (Ṣ, Mgh:) he made it to be in his possession, not to depart from his hand: (TA:) he acquired it for himself permanently, or for a permanence. See 1.
qanFA of the nose: see XamamN.
qnA wuX-aq a name given in Egypt to wuX-aq; also called OuX-aq and OuX-aj. (TA in art. AXq.)
qanaApN A spear-shaft; (Mgh;) a spear (T, Ṣ. Ḳ) that is hollow, like a cane; (Az, in TA;) a spear with a head affixed to it. (Mṣb.)
Hence, A subterranean channel, or conduit, for water. (Mgh.)
[And A pipe.]
qanaApu Alkuwzi The bulobul [or spout] of the kwz [or mug], that pours forth the water. (M, Ḳ, in art. bl.)
qanaApN, said to signify baqarapN waHoXiy-apN: see fanaApN.
finowapN: see qiniy-apN.
qinoyapN and qinowapN↓ Sheep, or goats, taken for oneself, gotten, or acquired, [for a permanent possession,] not for sale. (JK.)
OaqonaI in the prov., xalaAWuka OaqonaI liHayAYika i. q. Oalozamu [as meaning Most preservative: see that prov. in art. xlw, and see qaniIa AlHayaMCa, above]. (Ṣ in art. xlw, and Meyd.)
muqaAnaApN The weaving with one thread white and one thread black. (T, voce niyrN.)
qahozabN Short: (Ḳ:) an epithet applied to a man. (TA.)
R. Q. 1. qahoqaha He uttered a reiterated (Ḳ, TA) and prolonged, (TA,) or a vehement, laughter: (Ḳ:) or he laughed, reiterating the sound of qaho. (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ.)
qahoqaAhN: see HaqoHaAqN.

qahoqabN Big, bulky, or large in body; as also qahoqamN: (Seer, L:) or the same as an epithet applied to a camel: (TA:) or big, bulky, or large in body, and advanced in years; as also qahoqab-N, (Ḳ,) and qarohabN. (TA.)
Tall, or long, and having a capacious belly. (Ḳ.)
Hard, and strong, or robust. (M.)
I. q. baAci nojaAnN; (IAạr, Ḳ:) as also kahokabN. (TA.)
qahoqamN i. q. qahoqabN Big; bulky; large in body. (L.)
5. taqah-ala He was, or became, unfrequent in washing and cleansing his person; slovenly with respect to his person. (Ḳ.)
qahonabaAnN: see what follows.

qahan-abN Tall, and having a curving back, the upper part bending forward over the breast, or a bent and humped back, or a projecting breast and hollow back; accord. to the different explanations of OajonaOu: or tall; (Ḳ;) i. e., in an absolute sense; (TA;) as also qahonabaAnN↓. (Ḳ.) But AḤei and others assert that the n is augmentative. (MF.)
muqahonibN Always remaining at the water. (Ḳ.)
qaArapN A she-bear: see an ex. in art. fTn (conj. 2).
qawoTN: see an ex. in a verse cited voce raAjilapN.

qaAEN An even place; (Ṣ, voce maqad-N;) plain, or level, land, (Ṣ, Mṣb,) that produces nothing; (IF, Mṣb;) plain, or soft, land, (OaroDN saholapN,) low, and free from mountains. (Ḳ.) See also rawoDapN. Respecting its pls., see jaArN.
quwfN of the ear, The upper part: or the helix: see sak-a and Oasak-u and XanofN. Not to be confounded with fuwqN.
quwfN and qaAfN: see SuwfN.
qaAqN: see faAqN, in two places.
AlqaAfu AlmaqoEuwdapN: see art. qEd.
quwqN: see faAqN.

1. qaAla. The objective complement of qAl, meaning He said, or what is termed maquwlu Alqawoli, must be a complete proposition, or a word signifying at least one complete proposition, as kalaAmFA; or a word signifying a command or the like; or a word significant of a sound, termed Uisomu SawotK: it may be a verb; but cannot be an inf. n., as EibaAdapN. (Gr.) [This is what is meant where] it is said in the Keshsháf, AlEibaAdapu lA tuqaAlu. (Kull, p. 327.)
qaAla lahu signifies xaATaba lh: qAl Eanohu, rawaI Enh: qAl Ealayohi, AifotaraI Elyh: qAl bihi, Hakama bh and qAl fyh, Aijotahada fiyhi. (Marg. note in Additions to a copy of the KT.)
qaAla fiyhi famaA At-araka, i. e. Aijotahada fiyhi: see taraka.
qaAla Ealayohi, aor. _u {yaqowulu}, He lied, or said what was false, against him. (TA in art. tlw.) See taqaw-ala.
qaAla fiyhi and Eanohu He said of him, or it, such a thing.
qaAla bikacaA He asserted his belief in such a thing, as a doctrine or the like: a well-known meaning.
qaAlati AlEayonaAni The eyes made a sign [as though saying...]. (TA.)
qaAla biraOosihi He made a sign with his head: (TA:) or a motion. (Ḥam, p. 242.)
qaAla biyadihi He took [with his hand]. (TA.)
qaAla birijolihi He walked, or struck [with his leg, or foot]. (TA.)
qaAla bivawobihi He raised his garment. (TA.)
qaAla biAlmaMCi EalaI yadihi He poured the water on his arm or hand. (TA.)

sense.hi: He spoke against him; vituperated him.

entry.sense: qaAla XiEorFA lit., He said, or spoke, or put forth, or uttered, or gave utterance to, or recited, poetry; he spoke in verse; he poetized, or versified.

qaAla He made a sign; syn. OawomaOa. (Ḥam, p. 601, where see other meanings: see also p. 242 of the same: and see Mgh.) qaAla biyadihi [He made a sign with his hand, meaning to say...]. (A trad. cited voce HaT-a; and another voce Har-afa.) Also, He struck his hand upon a thing. (Mgh.) See an ex. voce. OaXoraba.
5. taqaw-ala Ealayohi He lied against him. (Ḥar, p. 256.)
8. AiqotaAla Ealayohi, (Ṣ,) or Ealayohimo, (Ḳ,) i. q. taHak-ama, (Ṣ,) or AiHotakama. (Ḳ.) See muWotaAlN.
qawolN A saying; something said: and speech, or diction.
SaEuba Ealayohi Alqawolu [Diction, or speech, was, or became, difficult to him]. (Ḳ in art. jbl.)
qayolN and miqowalN↓: see zaEiymN.
qiylN: see exs. voce OaSobaHa and voce Sir-aI.
qiylapN [A saying]. (M, art. Obd.)
qaAlapN: see fuw-ahapN, near the end.
qaw-aAlN, &c., Good in speech: or loquacious; or copious in speech; chaste, or perspicuous, in speech; and eloquent. (Ḳ.)
Uibonu OaqowaAlK The man who talks much. (TA in art. bnI.)
maquwlu Alqawoli The thing said: as kacaA in the phrases qaAla kacaA and yuqaAlu kacaA. See qaAla.
miqowalN: see qayolN.

AlmaquwlaAtu AlEaXoru, in logic, The Ten Predicaments, or Categories; namely, Aljawoharu Substance, Alkam-u Quantity, Alkayofu Quality, AlUiDaAfapu Relation, AlOayonu Place, or where, AlmataI Time, or when, AlwaDoEu Collocation, or posture, Almiloku Possession, or having, AlfiEolu Action, or doing, and AlUinofiEaAlu Passion, or suffering.
1. qaAma He stood still (Ksh and Bḍ in ii. 19) in his place. (Ksh.)

qaAmati Ald-aAb-apu The beast stopped (Ṣ, Ḳ, TA) from journeying, (TA,) from fatigue, or being jaded; (Ṣ, TA;) i. q. AnqTEt. (A.) And qaAmato Ealayohi Ald-aAb-apu His beast, being jaded, stopped with him, and moved not from its place. (Mgh.)
qaAma He, or it, stood up, or erect; syn. AinotaSaba. (Ḳ.) And hence, He rose, i. e. from sitting or reclining.
qaAma biAll-ayoli He rose in the night to pray.

qaAma ramaDaAna He passed the nights of Ramadán in prayer: (El-'Alkarnee in a marginal note in a copy of the Jámiʼ eṣ-Ṣagheer, voce mano:) or he performed the prayers [of Ramadán] called Alt-araAwiyH. (En-Nawawee, ibid.)
qaAmati AlS-alaApu The people rose to prayer: or the time of their doing so came. (TA.)
qaAmati Als-aAEapu The resurrection, or the time thereof, came to pass.
qaAmati AlX-amosu wakaAda AlZ-il-u yaEoqilu [The sun became high, and the shade almost disappeared, at midday]. (JK.)
qaAma Ealayohi He rose up against him: see a verse cited voce HuwbN.

qaAma biAlOamori He undertook the affair; took, or imposed, it upon himself; syn. takaf-ala bihi; and the epithet is qaAYimN and qay-imN: (Ḥam, p. 5:) [and] he managed, conducted, ordered, regulated, or superintended, the affair; syn. saAsahu; (TA in art. sws;) and qAm Ealayohi has this latter signification; and he tended, or took care of, it, or him; syn. saAsahu and waliyahu: (Ḥam ubi supra:) [and] the former signifies he attended to the affair; [occupied himself with it]; (this should be the first explanation;) was mindful of it; kept to it constantly, or steadily; and is contr. of qaEada Eanohu and taqaAEada: (JM, q. v.:) [or,] as contr. of qEd Enh and tqAEd, he acted vigorously in the affair; as also OaqaAmahu↓; syn. jad-a fiyhi, and tajal-ada. (Bḍ in ii. 2.)

You say, qaAma biXaOonihi He undertook, or superintended, or managed, his affair, or affairs. And you say, qaAma biAlyatiymi, (Mṣb in art. Ewl,) and biAlS-abiI-i, (Idem, art. kfl,) He maintained the orphan, and the child; syn. EaAlahu, and kafalahu: (Idem:) and qaAma AlmaroOapa, and EalayohaA, He undertook the maintenance of the woman; or he maintained her; (maAnahaA [i. e. qaAma bikifaAyatihaA (Ṣ and Ḳ in art. mwn)];) and undertook, or managed, her affair, or affairs. (Ḳ.) And Alr-ijaAlu yaquwmuwna EalaI Aln-isaMCi The men govern the women: (Bḍ, iv. 38:) or are mindful of them, and act well to them, or take care of them. (TA.)
qAma biEucoriI [He undertook, and it served, to excuse me]. (Mṣb and TA in art. Ecr;, &c.)
qaAma bihi He, or it, was supported, or sustained, by it; subsisted by it: see the explanation of qawaAmN in the Mṣb.
qaAma Ealayohi kacaA It cost him such a thing, such a sum, or so much.
qaAma often signifies vabata: so in qaAma fiI nafosihi Oan-ahu kacaA It was, or became, established in his mind that it was so.
qaAma yafoEalu kacaA He began to do such a thing; he betook himself to doing such a thing. (Zj, in TA, art. qdm.)
qaAma AlmaMCu † The water congealed, or froze; syn. jamada. (Ṣ, M, voce jamada.)
qaAmato Eayonuhu: see EayonN qaAYimapN.
qaAma qaAYimu AlZ-ahiyrapi: see Zahiyrap: there expl. from JK.
qaAma waqaEada: see qaEada; and OaqoEadahu; and see an ex. voce sud-apN.
qaAma has also for an inf. n. maqaAmN, agreeably with a general rule: see Bḍ in x. 72, &c.; and see maraAmN in art. rwm.
qaw-amahu bikacaA He valued it, or rated it, as equal to, or worth, such a thing. A phrase well known, and used in the present day.
qaw-amahu He set its price; assigned it its price; valued it; (Ṣ,* Mṣb, Ḳ;) as also AisotaqaAmahu↓. (Mṣb, Ḳ.)
qaw-amotuhu fataqaw-ama↓ i. q. Ead-alotuhu fataEad-ala. (Mṣb.)
qaw-ama He made a writing, and an account, or a reckoning, accurate, or exact, or right.
3. qaAwamahu [He rose against him, and withstood him, or opposed him, in contention;] namely, his adversary. (Mgh in art. nhD.)
It was equal, or equivalent, to it. (Mṣb.)
qaAwamahu fiI AlHarobi He opposed him, or contended with him for equality, in war, or battle. (MA.)
qaAwamahu fiI HaAjapK He rose, or stood, with him [or assisted him] to accomplish some needful affair. (IAth, TA.)
qaAwamahu It was equal, or equivalent, to it: see Mṣb: syn. EaAdalahu, q. v. (TA in art. bwO.)
yuqaAwimu Als-umuwm [It counteracts poisons]. (TA, art. bls.)
4. OaqaAma He set up, put up, set upright, a thing. (Mṣb.)
OaqaAmahu, said of food, [It sustained him, supported him]. (Mṣb.)
OaqaAma EalaI xaTarK He stood to a bet, wager, or stake. (TA, voce nadabN.)
OaqaAma Ealayohi AlH-ada He inflicted upon him the punishment termed Had-N. (Mgh, art. Hd.)
OaqaAma daroOahu: see drO.
OaqaAma lilS-alaApi, inf. n. UiqaAmapN, He (the mubal-ig) recited the form of words called UiqaAmap, q. v. infra.
OaqaAma He remained, continued, stayed, tarried, resided, dwelt, or abode, in a place: he remained stationary.
OaqaAma AlS-alaApa, He observed prayer: or OadaAma fiEolahaA. (Ṣ, Mṣb.) See also Bḍ, and Jel ii. 2.
See 1.
OaqaAmahu EalaI AlT-ariyqi He made him to keep to the road: and llqaSodi, to the right way. (L, art. lgd.)
See 10.
OaqaAama AlOamora He put the affair into a right state; like naZamahu: see the latter in the Mṣb.
OaqaAmahu (Ḳ in art. Edl) He made it to be conformable with that which is right; namely, a judgment, a judicial decision. (TḲ in that art.)
See 2.
OaqaAma bihi in the Ḥamáseh, p. 75, 1. 9, app. signifies He stood in his stead.
OaqaAma He observed, or duly performed, a religious, or moral, ordinance or duty.

OaqaAma Albay-inapa [He established the evidence or proof; and so AqAm bihaA? the b being redundant]. (Bḍ, iii. 68.) And [in like manner,] AqAm Huj-atahu i. q. OavobatahaA; (TA in art. vbt;) and so, app., biHuj-atihi; the b being redundant, as in an ex. voce xuT-apN; but this is the only ex. that I know, and it is without explanation: Golius mentions the phrase OaqaAma biI Ealayokumo; but without indicating his authority.

OaqaAma EalaI HaAlK He abode, or continued, in a state, or condition; and AqAm ElI OamorK the same; and he abode, continued, stayed, or waited, intent upon, or occupied in, an affair, a business, or a concern; he kept to it.
5. taqaw-ama It subsisted: see rukonN.

sense.hi: It had a price; was valued.

entry.sense: See 2.
6. taqaAwamuwhu fiymaA bayonahumo They valued it, or estimated its price, among them. (TA.)
10. AisotaqaAma It became right; direct; in a right state; straight: even: tended towards the right, or desired, point, or object; had a right direction, or tendency; was regular.
AisotaqaAma EalaI Tariyqi AlHaq-i (Ḳ, art. rXd) He continued in the way of truth, or the right way; as also Ealayohi
OaqaAma?
lamo yasotaqimi AlOamoru The affair was, or became, difficult: see taEac-ara.
AstqAm lahu AlOamoru The affair, or case, became in a right state for him; syn. AiEotadala. (Ṣ.)

AisotaqaAma He, or it, was, or became, right, direct, rightly directed, undeviating, straight, or even: and he, or it, stood right, or straight, or erect. (MA, KL.) He went right on, straight on, or undeviatingly: (see zaEaba:) whence AisotaqaAma EalaI AlT-ariyqapi he went on undeviatingly in the way. (See Ḳur lxxii. 16.)
