He went right; pursued a right course; acted rightly, or justly. See also sad-a, with which it is syn. It (an affair) was direct in its tendency, or had a right tendency. It (discourse, &c.) had a right tenour.
See 2.

qawomN [A people, or body of persons composing a community: and people, or persons:] a company, or body, [or party, (see what follows,)] of men, [properly] without women: (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ, &c.:) or of men and women together; (Ḳ;) for the qwm of every man is his party, and his kinsfolk, or tribe: (TA:) or (Ḳ) sometimes including women, as followers; (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ;) for the qwm of every prophet is of men and women. (Ṣ, Mṣb.)
qawomN opposed to nisaMCN: see a verse cited voce sawofa.
qaAmapN The stature of a man; his height in a standing posture; it is a span (Xibor) shorter than a bAE: (JK:) tallness, height; and beauty, or justness, of stature. (Ḳ.)

qaAmapN A structure [or post] like the figure of a man, raised at the side of a well, whereon is placed the wood to which the pulley is attached: pl. qaAmN: (JK:) also called qaAYimapN↓: see Ḳ, voce Eamuwd: or qaAmapu AlbakorapN signifies the sheave (bakorap) with its apparatus. (Ṣ, Ḳ.)
diynN qiyamN A right religion. (Ḳur, vi. 162.) See dir-apN.
Alr-iyaAHu Alquw-amu The right [or cardinal] winds. (Ṣ, voce nakobaACu.)
Ald-iynu Alqay-imu (Ḳur ix. 36) The right, correct, or true, reckoning. (T in art. dyn.)
qay-imu AlOamori i. q. muqiymuhu↓ and saAYisuhu: fem. qay-imapN. (TA.)
qay-imN biAlOamori A manager of an affair; i. q. UizaAWuhu. (Ṣ, Mṣb, art. AzI.) See qaAma biAlOamori.

qay-imN A manager, conductor, orderer, regulator, or superintendent, of an affair: (TA:) a manager, conductor,, &c., of the affairs of a people. (JK.) qay-imN EalaI AlmaAli A good [manager and] tender of camels,, &c. (TA in art. blw.)
qiymapN The real value, or worth, of a thing; its equivalent; differing from vamanN, q. v. (MF in art. vmn.)
qawaAmN Stature, and goodly stature, or tallness, of a man: (Ṣ:) symmetry, or justness of proportion. (Mṣb.)

qiwaAmu AlOamori and qiyaAmuhu and qawaAmuhu The stay, or support, of the thing, or affair, whereby it subsists, and is managed and ordered. (Mṣb.) And qiwaAmN The food that is a man's support; (Mṣb;) [his subsistence.]
qiwaAmN [The main stay of a thing.]
laA qiwaAma lahu bihi [He has not power to withstand him.] (Ḳ, art. njz.)
qiwaAmN Subsistence: see rukonN and TabaEN.
qiyaAmN [A state of purging, or flux of the belly: used in this sense in the Ṣ, Ḳ, voce hayoDapN].
qawiymN: see SawiybN.
Alqay-uwmu: see yaA qay-uwmu in the last paragraph of art. Xrh, where I have rendered it on the authority of an explanation in the TA.
qaw-aAmN One who rises much, or often, in the night to pray. (TA.) See Saw-aAmN.
quwmiy-apN is written with damm in copies of the Ṣ, Ḳ, JK: in the CK, erroneously, qawomiy-apN, in both senses. See voce mutaXam-isN.
qaAYimapN, pl. qawaAYimu, Leg of a horse, &c.

EayonN qaAYimapN An eye [blind, or white and blind, but still whole or] that has become white and blind, but not yet burst, (AZ in L, art. sd,) or sightless, but with the black still remaining. (Mgh, Mṣb.)
qaAYimN and qaAYimapN The hilt of a sword. (Mṣb.)
qawamapu bayoti Aln-aAri (Ḳ, art. hrbc.) The servants of the fire-temple. (TA, same art.)
AlqawaAYimu The winds. So in a verse of Umeiyeh Ibn-Abi-s-Salt. (TA, voce sadirN.)
qawaAYimu AlmaAYidapi [The legs of the table]. (Ḳ, art. Eqr.)
qaT-N qaAYimN A nibbing in which the pith and the exterior of the reed are made of equal length: opposed to muSaw-abN. (TA in art. Hrf.)
maMCN qaAYimN Frozen water. And stagnant water: see HibaAk.

UiqaAmapN The form of words chanted by the mubal-ig, not by the muWac-in, consisting of the common words of the OacaAn, with the addition of qado qaAmati AlS-alaApu (The time of prayer has come!) pronounced twice after HaI-a EalaI AlfalaAHi. See vaw-aba.

maqaAmN The place of the feet; (Ḳ;) a standingplace; (Ṣ, Mṣb;) as also muqaAmN↓: (Ṣ:) or the latter, a place of stationing: (Mṣb:) and both, a place of continuance, stay, residence, or abode: (Ḳ:) [a standing:] and the latter, a place of long continuance, stay, residence, or abode: (Expos. of the Moʼallaḳát, Calc., p. 138:) and both, continuance, stay, residence, or abode. (Ṣ, Ḳ.)
muqaAmN: see maqaAmN.
muqiymN Lasting; continuing: (Bḍ, ix. 21:) unceasing. (Bḍ, ix. 69.)
Oaxacahu Almuqiymu AlmuqoEidu: see art. qEd.
See qay-imN.

maqaAmapN A standing-place. Hence, † A sittingplace. Hence, † The persons sitting there. Hence, † An oration, or a discourse, or an exhortation, (xuTobap Aw EiZap,) or the like, there delivered; as also majolisN. (Mṭr, in De Sacy's ed. of El-Ḥareeree, p. 5.)
HajarN mutaqaw-imN (Ḳ, art. mws) A precious stone. (TA, same art.)
taqowiymaAtN [pl. of taqowiymN] Stellar calculations. (TA, voce AiyjN.)
quwhapN: see fuw-ahapN, last sentence.
1. qawiIa and taqaw-aI↓ (Ṣ, Ḳ) and AiqotawaI↓ (Ḳ) He became strong: (Ṣ, Ḳ:) vigorous, robust, or sturdy; like AiXotad-a, or the last signifies he became excellent in strength. (TA.)

qawiIa Ealayohi He had strength, or power, sufficient for it; or he had strength, or power, to endure it; he prevailed against it; namely, travel, adversity, &c. And He or it, prevailed over him, or it.
See 4.

qawiIa is [said to be] originally qawiwa, because it is from Alquw-apu: (I’Aḳ, p. 368:) but Lth holds quw-apN to be [anomalous,] originally quwyapN. (TA.) I prefer the former opinion, and think it should be mentioned in art. qw, or I would rather head this art. qw or qwI, like gw or gwI. ISd holds quw-apN to be from qww, like vuw-apN, q. v. from vww.
2. qaw-aAhu: see Xad-ahu.
qaw-aAniI Ealayohi: see 2 in art. Twq.
3. qaAwaAhu He vied with him, strove to surpass him, or contended with him for superiority, (Ṣ, Ḳ,) in strength: (TA:) i. q. XaAd-ahu. (A, L in art. Xd.)
4. Oaqowati Ald-aAru The house became empty, vacant, or unoccupied; (Ṣ, Mgh, Mṣb, Ḳ;) as also qawiyat↓. (Ṣ, Ḳ.)
5. taqaw-aI He strengthened himself; made himself, or constrained himself to be, strong; affected, or endeavoured to acquire, strength. See 1.
taqaw-aI mina AlX-aIoCi biqawomihi: see taman-aEa.
8: see 1.
fuw-apN Strength, power, potency, might, or force; contr. of DaEofN; (Ṣ, Ḳ;) in body, and in intellect: (TA:) vigour, robustness, or sturdiness; like Xid-ap.

quw-apN A strand; i. e., a single twist of a rope; a yarn; a distinct, and separately twisted, portion, of two or more which, being twisted together, compose the whole, of a rope, and of a string, or thread. See also vinoIN.
A faculty. Ex. Als-amoEu quw-apN fiI AlAucuni bihaA tudoriku AlOaSowaAta [AlsmE is a faculty in the ear by which it perceives sounds]. (TA in art. smE.)
biAlquw-api Potentially, or virtually; as opposed to biAlfiEoli, i. e. actually.
quw-apu lafoZK: see layota.
bit-u qawiyFA, and qaAwiyFA, and muqowiyFA: see gawFI and gawiI-N in art. gw.
qay-aAsN: see qaw-aAsN.
maqiysN (not muqay-asN) Consistent with analogy.
miqoyaSN: see maqowasN.
1. qaADa: see AnqAS, art. qyS.
7. UinoqaADa: see AnqAS, art. qyS.
munoqaADN: see munoqaASN.
qayoZiI-N: on the nitaAj thus called see SafariI-N.

qiyqaMCN, (Ḳ, voce talotalapN; Ṣ, Ḳ, voce rafaDa, and voce waliyEN; Ḳ, voce juf-N;, &c.,) or qiyqaMCapN, (Ṣ, voce talotalapN; and TA,) and qiyqaOapN, (TA,) or qiyqaApN and qiyqaAyapN, (JK,) The envelope (qiXor, JK, or wiEaMC, TA) of the TaloE [or spadix of the palm-tree]; (JK, TA;) which is made into a drinking-vessel, like the talotalap: (JK:) the qiyqaMC of the TaloE is the envelope (giXaMC) that is with the waliyE. (Ḳ, voce juf-N.)
qiyqN and see faAqN.
quyAaqN: see faAqN.
qyqAC see voce HarabN and Ḳ, voce waliyEN and juf-N.
1. qaAla He slept during midday: (Mgh:) or he stayed during midday. (TA, art. hjr.)
qay-ala: see another meaning, voce bay-ata.
3. qaAyalahu AlbayoEa [He dissolved, rescinded, or annulled, with him the sale]. (A, art. rd.)

4. OaqaAla Qll-ehu Eavorataka, and EivAaraka, [May God cancel thy slip, lapse, fault, wrong action, or mistake:] (A, art. Evr:) may God raise thee from thy fall. (Mṣb, art. qyl.) OaqaAlahu Eavoratahu He forgave him his slip, lapse, or fault. (MA.)
5. taqay-ala OabaAhu: see taqay-aDa and taOas-ala.

10. AisotaqAala AlbayoEa He desired, or demanded, the rescinding of the sale, or purchase. (MA.) And AstqAl AlEanowapu He desired, or demanded, his passing over, or forgiving, the slip, lapse, or fault. (MA.) See also Ḥar, p. 7. See also a verse cited voce EanowapN.
qaAYilapN: see gaAaYirahN.

maqiylN A resting-place; syn. musotaqar-N: hence, maqiylu AlHub-i [the resting-place of love] and maqiylu AlgayoZi [the resting-place of wrath], applied by El-Mutanebbee to the heart. (W, i. 112.) See an ex. (mistranslated) in De Sacy's Ar. Gr., sec. ed., ii. 165: the same, with a var., in Ibn-Akeel p. 210.
qayonN The part, of a camel, that is the place of the shackle, or hobble. (Ḥam, p. 558.) See a verse of Dhu-r-Rummeh, voce daAnaI.
